jobDescription: Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Systems Engineering General Summary Qualcomm Government Technologies (QGOV) is a unique division within Qualcomm that partners with the U.S. Government to bring the latest in new and innovative commercial technologies to the government space. QGOV is seeking an experienced 5G cellular systems engineer to architect solutions incorporating commercial Qualcomm System on Chip (SoC) processors into U.S. Government applications. The ideal candidate has strong cellular (5G) knowledge from theory to hands on experience, including protocol knowledge in the air interface (from L1 PHY to L2/L3 upper layers) across both network and UE perspectives; a strong communication theory background is highly desirable along with embedded software experience in the modem space. A successful applicant must have excellent interpersonal, teamwork and organizational skills, as well as proven skills generating system design documentation and comfortable navigating through 3GPP standards and modem code in order to understand the tradeoffs in design vs implementation. Skills And Experience Strong knowledge of cellular (5G NR) PHY/MAC/RLC/PDCP and upper layers along with a strong understanding of RF principles including MIMO techniques Familiarity with 3GPP protocol standards (Rel 15 – Rel 18), 5G call flows Strong in Communication Theory, algorithms as it pertains to 5G, signal processing Experience in understanding how cellular modems work, and comfortable navigating and making changes to embedded C/C++ modem code across various modem subsystems and layers Ability to effectively work with multi-functional engineering teams Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 4+ years of Systems Engineering or related work experience. OR Master's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 3+ years of Systems Engineering or related work experience. OR PhD in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 2+ years of Systems Engineering or related work experience. Minimum Qualifications Must be a U.S. citizen and eligible for a U.S. Government security clearance*** BSEE or BSCS with focus in Cellular/Wireless Communication Systems, 5+ years’ experience Preferred Qualifications A current/active Top Secret (TS/SI) security clearance MSEE or PhD with focus in Cellular/Wireless Communication Systems, 8+ years of experience Although this role has some expected minor physical activity, this should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. jobTitle: ADAS/Autonomy – PMIC Safety Architect, Principal Engineer
jobDescription: Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Systems Engineering General Summary Qualcomm is utilizing its traditional strengths in digital wireless technologies to play a central role in the evolution of automotive infotainment and autonomous driving. We are investing in several supporting technologies including 4G, 5G, ADAS, and Deep Learning. The Qualcomm ADAS/Autonomy Systems team is engaged in offering optimized solutions built on DSP, computer vision and machine learning algorithms for the Qualcomm ADAS/Autonomy systems architecture. We are seeking engineers with experience in system and device level functional safety concepts and implementations. This position will be a hands-on role in analyzing Functional Safety concepts and requirements in existing and next generation ADAS/Autonomy systems offered by Qualcomm, while optimizing and exercising the full capability of the Qualcomm Snapdragon platform. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 8+ years of Systems Engineering or related work experience. OR Master's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 7+ years of Systems Engineering or related work experience. OR PhD in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 6+ years of Systems Engineering or related work experience. Preferred Qualifications 8+ years Systems Engineering or related work experience. Master’s degree in electrical engineering with strong analog IC design background. Strong knowledge and experience on architecting and/or designing core PMIC related IPs such as SMPS (buck, boost, buck-boost), as well as foundation IPs such as LDOs, ADC, Bandgap, POR. Knowledge of transistor-level analog circuit simulation tools and frontend environments with extensive experience with Cadence Virtuoso Knowledge of BCD (Bipolar, CMOS, DMOS) silicon process technologies Experienced in Automotive related constraints such as ESD, EMC, functional safety requirements and design techniques to meet such constraints is a must Experience in performing Analog block related FMEA and FMEDA is essential Excellent communication and leadership skills 5+ years of experience in the following: ISO 26262 or IEC 61508 Requirements Management Tools and establishing traceability for functional safety requirements e.g. DOORS, etc. Familiarity with Failure Modes and Effect Analysis (FMEA) and Fault Tree Analysis (FTA) is required experience using tools to perform FMEA, FTA preferred Familiarity with hardware failure rate calculation (FMEDA) experience using Siemens 29500 and/or IEC 62380 preferred Prior automotive experience in ADAS and self-driving systems preferred Relevant Safety Certification is desired e.g. CFSE, CFSP Principal Duties And Responsibilities Developing a system level safety architecture and concept to integrate QUALCOMM’s hardware in safety critical systems, leading and coordinating the creation of functional safety documentation as per ISO 26262. Develop safety requirements to implement Technical Safety Concepts (TSCs) on QUALCOMM’s Snapdragon automotive hardware Work with various technology teams on architectural features that would enable targeted safety levels (ASIL B to ASIL D, depending upon the technology team and system level requirements) Conducting safety analyses, both quantitative and qualitative, on automotive hardware designs and identify areas of improvement Responsibilities will include leading functional safety related activities for SoC development and ensure ISO 26262 compliance with respect to SoC architecture, processes and work products. Work closely with Quality teams, SoC Design and IP teams, Software team, the functional safety manager(s) as well as customers to ensure the functional safety process is executed and documented. Working with vendors and partners to ensure functional safety requirements are fulfilled by the components that they provide Although this role has some expected minor physical activity, this should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Systems Test Engineering General Summary Tests and modifies general systems-level software/hardware, specialized utility and/or hardware. Interprets wireless specifications. Designs test plans, scenarios, scripts, or procedures. Documents systems-level defects, using a bug tracking system, and report defects to developers. Identifies, analyzes, troubleshoots, and documents problems with program function, output, or content. Develops testing programs that assess effectiveness of a new system or modification of an existing system. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 2+ years of Systems Test Engineering or related work experience. OR Master's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 1+ year of Systems Test Engineering or related work experience. OR PhD in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field. Preferred Qualifications 4+ years of Systems Test Engineering or related work experience. Principal Duties and Responsibilities: Conducts log analyses to identify where an issue has occurred and makes recommendations for how to address the issue. Understands basic features of the system. Collects information (e.g., logs, requirements) and identifies basic patterns/trends related to systems testing. Manages individual project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables with minimal supervision. Determines which work tasks are most important for self and junior engineers, avoids distractions, and completes work in a timely manner. Communicates detailed and regular feedback about identified feature issues to software and systems teams. Collaborates with individuals inside own team and with other teams to complete project work. Resolves straightforward technical issues and escalates to technical leads, as necessary. Adapts to significant changes and setbacks in order to manage pressure and meet deadlines. Gathers, integrates, and interprets information from a variety of sources to troubleshoot issues and find solutions. Detects bugs in the "system under test" and resolves issues using more advanced debugging approaches. Conducts more advanced field or lab tests as directed by tech leads. Seeks opinions of others within own team about ways in which a problem can be addressed differently. Knowledge in one or more of the following operating systems is preferred: Android, QNX, embedded Linux. Strong foundation in Machine Learning and applications within the Automotive areas towards Autonomy is a plus Foundational understanding of Automotive Test processes like ASPICE/ ISO26262 2-5 years work experience in embedded test or automotive test with excellent software programming skills in C/C++/Python Good Scripting skills: Python fundamentals for test frameworks and test automation development towards CI/CD Solid Computer architecture fundamentals and strong background in one or more technologies like AI/Multimedia/Camera/Computer Vision Experience with HIL (Hardware in Loop) and SIL (Software in Loop) test methodologies used for testing embedded systems Principal Duties And Responsibilities Working under some supervision. Making decisions that are moderate in impact; errors may have relatively minor financial impact or effect on projects, operations, or customer relationships; errors may require involvement beyond immediate work group to correct. Using verbal and written communication skills to convey information that may be somewhat complex to others who may have limited knowledge of the subject in question. May require basic negotiation and influence, cooperation, tact, and diplomacy, etc. Having a moderate amount of influence over key organizational decisions (e.g., is consulted by senior leadership to provide input on key decisions). Completing tasks with multiple steps that can be performed in various orders; some planning and prioritization must occur to complete the tasks effectively; mistakes may result in some rework. Exercising creativity to draft original documents, imagery, or work products within established guidelines. Using deductive and inductive problem solving; multiple approaches may be taken/necessary to solve the problem; often information is missing or incomplete; intermediate data analysis/interpretation skills may be required. Company Arriver Software, LLC Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Software Engineering General Summary As an Algorithm Engineer on Qualcomm's Vehicle Guidance teams, you will join a Detroit-based cross functional development team working on ADAS and AD features. You will follow agile methodologies to contribute to the vehicle guidance software stack. The algorithms you’ll be developing use map data and perception/sensor information to make driving decisions that allow the autonomous vehicle to safely function alongside other vehicles and objects on the road.      What you'll do:  Design, simulate, implement, and test behavior prediction including trajectory and intent prediction  Train and improve novel machine learning models to predict trajectories for road users and optimize them to run on real-time systems   Collaborate with upstream (perception and localization) and downstream (motion prediction and vehicle controls) teams to ensure proper feature functionality  Evaluate and improve algorithm performance  System debugging and data analysis to root-cause and solve issues  Perform tests in various environments (SiL, HiL, in-vehicle) to verify system performance and robustness  Collaborate with systems engineers to support the creation and break-down of requirements and test cases  Perform system tuning and develop calibration guidelines  Follow defined software development and documentation procedures  Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field. Preferred Qualifications:  Master’s degree in Engineering (Mechanical, Electrical, Aerospace, or similar), Math, Computer Science, or related field.  Prior experience working on a cross-functional development team in an agile environment.  Prior experience working with behavior prediction for autonomous agents  Proficient in variety of deep learning models (ANNs) like CNN, RNN, LSTM, VAE, GraphCNN etc  Proficient in MLOps (e.g. pytorch, tensor flow, KubeFlow, AirFlow) Prior experience with CI/CD or build management.  Prior experience working with the Tools & Technologies listed in the next section.  Tools & Technology:  C++ and Python development in mainly Linux, but also Windows environment  Although this role has some expected minor physical activity, this should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. jobTitle: AR/VR Software Architecture Engineer (San Diego, Santa Clara, or Boulder)
jobDescription: Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > GPU ASICS Engineering General Summary Qualcomm's GPU AR/VR Architecture Team is a group of talented engineers that work to advance state-of-the-art Virtual Reality (VR) and Augmented Reality (AR) 3D graphics capabilities. Through close collaboration with graphics driver developers we research and develop new GPU hardware features. Our backgrounds are rooted in a strong understanding of 3D API's like Vulkan, OpenGLES and/or D3D. In some cases based on graphics driver development experience. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field and 2+ years of Software Engineering, Hardware Engineering, Systems Engineering, or related work experience. OR Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field and 1+ year of Software Engineering, Hardware Engineering, Systems Engineering, or related work experience. OR PhD in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field. Team Responsibilities Include Discover customer requirements for next gen AR/VR devices Analyze and influence future GPU architectures Validate GPU features through HW or SW simulation Implement GPU compiler and driver features Analyze and debug code generation issues Implement 3D test applications to validate power, performance or quality concepts for new features More Background On Our Team Qualcomm's GPU Architecture Team is responsible for the development of the worlds most advanced graphics processing unit (GPU). The Adreno GPU is part of Qualcomm's System on a Chip (SOC) platform found in mobile phones, virtual and augmented reality headsets, wearables, laptop computers and more. The highly motivated VR/AR Team has been responsible for the graphics HW at the heart of some of the most popular VR/AR offerings like Meta/Oculus Quest1 & 2 and Microsoft Hololens2. Our responsibilities include: forward looking architecture, research and design, tools, frameworks, compilers, display and GPU drivers. We work on advancing 3D rendering concepts for gaming, VR and AR through analysis of interactions between user experience, driver SW behavior and HW capabilities. Balancing performance, power and quality requirements across the SOC. Beyond traditional graphics, the GPU architecture team works on advancing machine learning, ray tracing, and enhanced developer tools to facilitate debugging, optimizing, and deploying applications for existing and new Qualcomm SOC based devices. Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Software Engineering General Summary Qualcomm is a world leading provider of mobile phone, industrial and consumer IoT, headset, wearable, and automotive infotainment and telematic SoCs and software technology. Our technology solutions not only bring function and high-speed wireless connectivity to mobile devices, powering the majority of smartphones around the globe, but also to a broad spectrum of other wirelessly connected devices spanning IoT, compute, voice & music, wearable, and automotive products. As a member of the Audio Software global development team at Qualcomm, you will have the opportunity to work with an international team of hardware, systems, and software engineers to develop cutting edge audio and voice technology employed by a wide-ranging set of products from smart phones and smart speakers, to smart cameras and smart routers to smart TVs, soundbars, and other entertainment devices to voice activated appliances and smart home devices. The Audio Software team drives the feature design, development, integration, and commercialization of audio and voice software running on Qualcomm's Snapdragon processors. General responsibilities include the design, implementation, integration, and commercialization of embedded audio and voice software that runs on Qualcomm’s Snapdragon Hexagon DSP and ARM control processors and meet specified performance, latency, power, robustness, and stability metrics. Successful execution of these responsibilities requires proficiency in C/C++, Python, and other scripting languages; troubleshooting and debugging skills in embedded, preemptive execution environments; adept analysis of product and use case requirements; design, implementation, maintenance, and evolution of audio signal processing frameworks and services, embedded drivers (USB, I2S, Display Port, DMA), algorithmic processing modules (machine learning enhanced echo cancellers, noise suppressors, voice UI activation and wake word engines, context detection and sensing fusion, and signal clarity and effects filters), and voice & music encoders/decoders for mobile, compute, IoT, and other 5G and Bluetooth (BLE) enabled devices. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field. Preferred Qualifications 1+ year of experience with Programming Language such as C, C++, Java, Python, etc. 1+ year of experience with Database Management Software. 1+ year of experience with API. 1+ year of experience working in a large matrixed organization. Principal Duties And Responsibilities Communicates issues with team lead and peers. Adapts to changes and setbacks in order to meet deadlines. Communicates with project lead to provide status and information about impending obstacles. Collaborates with others inside project team to accomplish project objectives. Gathers, integrates, and interprets information specific to a module or sub-block of code from a variety of sources in order to troubleshoot issues and find solutions. Collaborates with individuals within domain to complete the team's work. Stays focused and deals with setbacks in a timely manner. Seeks out learning opportunities to increase own knowledge and skill. Completes assigned coding tasks to specifications on time without significant errors or bugs. Resolves straightforward software issues and bugs within a reasonable amount of time. Actively seeks answers for new challenges. Prioritizes project deadlines and deliverables with close supervision. Is receptive to others' suggestions about ways in which a problem can be addressed differently. Escalates technical issues to an appropriate party (e.g., project lead, colleagues). Networks with colleagues within domain to gain insight, ideas, and connections. Level Of Responsibility Working under close supervision. Taking responsibility for own work and making decisions with limited impact; Impact of decisions is readily apparent; errors made typically only impact timeline (i.e., require additional time to correct). Using verbal and written communication skills to convey basic, routine factual information about day-to-day activities to others who are fully knowledgeable in the subject area. Completing most tasks with multiple steps which can be performed in various orders; some planning and prioritization must occur to complete the tasks effectively; mistakes may result in some rework. Exercising some creativity to troubleshoot technical problems or deal with novel circumstances. Using deductive problem solving to solve moderately complex problems; most problems have defined processes of diagnosis/detection; some limited data analysis may be required. jobTitle: Automotive CPU Functional Safety Manager - San Diego, CA, Santa Clara, Austin, TX or Chandler, AZ
jobDescription: Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > ASICS Engineering General Summary At Qualcomm we’re developing the next generations of in-vehicle entertainment and autonomous driving systems (IVI / ADAS). We’re leading the industry on performance, safety levels and connectivity. We’re collaborating with industry leading partners and vehicle makers on great products and features. Qualcomm’s Snapdragon Ride platform integrates cutting edge technologies in vision, DSP, graphics, AI and CPU. This is a leadership position in the Qualcomm SoC CPU Subsystem team, focusing on development of next generation Automotive systems. You will be responsible for leading the efforts on functionally safe CPU systems, focusing on continuous improvements in safety levels. We are seeking engineers with experience in CPU and system level functional safety concepts. A successful candidate will have a positive attitude that drives functional safety programs across organizational boundaries, delivering to our customers while adhering to ISO processes. The senior position requires the understanding and definition of Hardware Safety requirements, understanding Safety Mechanisms in 3rd party IP, CPU microarchitecture and support for the development of safety test software. Interaction with customers, architects, functional safety, commercial and test/integration teams are required as part of the job. Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field. Experience in CPU architecture 7+ years ASIC design, verification or related work experience. Preferred Qualifications 15+ years of ASIC Design and Development. jobTitle: Automotive DFT Engineer (San Diego or Austin)
jobDescription: Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > ASICS Engineering General Summary Qualcomm is a company of inventors that unlocked 5G ushering in an age of rapid acceleration in connectivity and new possibilities that will transform industries, create jobs, and enrich lives. But this is just the beginning. It takes inventive minds with diverse skills, backgrounds, and cultures to transform 5Gs potential into world-changing technologies and products. This is the Invention Age - and this is where you come in. The Digital ASIC Design Team is currently seeking candidates who will be responsible for the implementation and verification of advanced DFT/DFD (Design for Test/Design for Debug) techniques for low power, multi voltage designs. The successful candidate will help in the deployment of DFT methodologies that reduce test cost, increase product quality, and enhance yield learning on leading edge process technologies. The candidate should have solid hands-on experience with industry standard DFT techniques such as scan and MBIST. Job responsibilities include DFT pattern generation, coverage analysis and debug as well as running and debugging gate level simulations. The ideal candidate will have experience in both pre, and post-silicon in the DFT domain. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Science, Engineering, or related field and 4+ years of ASIC design, verification, or related work experience. OR Master's degree in Science, Engineering, or related field and 3+ years of ASIC design, verification, or related work experience. OR PhD in Science, Engineering, or related field and 2+ years of ASIC design, verification, or related work experience. Minimum BS or MS in Computer or Electrical Engineering (or equivalent degree) with 10+ years experience in all aspects of Design-for-Test (DFT) for mobile SoCs targeted towards automotive segment, with special emphasis on in-system test using LBIST and MBIST. This position requires in-depth knowledge of scan, ATPG, LBIST and MBIST hardware and tools, and the successful candidate is expected to architect and develop design methodology and flows for low-cost in-system test insertion and verification for widespread deployment across design teams. Familiarity with ISO 26262 and associated processes is a plus. Strong programming and scripting skills with languages such as TCL/Perl is required. The candidate should also have experience in guiding physical design and timing teams during implementation to enable proper tradeoff between design cost/effort and testability goals, and be able to provide support to post-silicon teams in debugging issues found in silicon. Candidate should have strong documentation, communication and collaboration skills, and should be a quick learner to work in a fast-paced and dynamic design environment. Although this role has some expected minor physical activity, this should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. If you are an individual with a physical or mental disability and need an accommodation during the application/hiring process, please call Qualcomm’s toll-free number found here for assistance. Qualcomm will provide reasonable accommodations, upon request, to support individuals with disabilities as part of our ongoing efforts to create an accessible workplace. Minimum BS or MS in Computer or Electrical Engineering (or equivalent degree) with 10+ years experience in all aspects of Design-for-Test (DFT) for mobile SoCs targeted towards automotive segment, with special emphasis on in-system test using LBIST and MBIST. This position requires in-depth knowledge of scan, ATPG, LBIST and MBIST hardware and tools, and the successful candidate is expected to architect and develop design methodology and flows for low-cost in-system test insertion and verification for widespread deployment across design teams. Familiarity with ISO 26262 and associated processes is a plus. Strong programming and scripting skills with languages such as TCL/Perl is required. The candidate should also have experience in guiding physical design and timing teams during implementation to enable proper tradeoff between design cost/effort and testability goals, and be able to provide support to post-silicon teams in debugging issues found in silicon. Candidate should have strong documentation, communication and collaboration skills, and should be a quick learner to work in a fast-paced and dynamic design environment. Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Develops testing programs that assess effectiveness of a new system or modification of an existing system. Willing to travel and weekend work Good communication skills for customer interactions and or demo and tradeshow support. Experience in customer interaction for support, demo and trial. Software and hardware troubleshooting. Able to come up to speed on new hardware and application platforms (Sensor and Tools) Background in RF technologies, test and troubleshooting. WIFI, 3G and LTE. IP network understanding. Preferred Expertise in wireless and wireline sensors (setup and installation) is Preferred Understanding of autonomous vehicle setup a plus. IP network setup and management. Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Software Engineering General Summary Qualcomm has pioneered connected car technologies for over a decade and continues play a central role in the evolution of automotive infotainment, autonomous driving & its supporting technologies in 4G/5G, ADAS, Deep Learning etc., across the globe. Qualcomm is working closely with standards bodies, consortiums, automakers and operators on advancing Vehicle-to-Vehicle (V2V) and Vehicle-to-everything (V2X) standards and architectures, and is a key member in the Towards 5G initiative for advancing Cellular V2X (CV2X) capabilities on the road to 5G. With connectivity integrated into the latest infotainment, cluster and telematics systems Qualcomm will make travel safer, more efficient and enjoyable. We welcome smart, energetic software engineers with a passion to make a positive difference on the many technologies and automotive products that will shape our future to join our growing, multisite development team. This position involves implementing the next generation of products in infotainment, autonomous driving, safety and telematics working with Tier1s, OEMs and industry partners in various supporting technologies by utilizing system software, coding and problem solving skills. The engineer will work closely with cross-functional teams at across multiple locations to coordinate engineering the system solutions and working through to commercialization. Preferred Qualifications Experience in embedded/automotive software, kernel & User space driver development Experience with at least one of the operating systems Linux/Android, QNX or INTEGRITY. Exposure to platform level debugging skills and experience with pre-silicon/SoC bringup. Automotive software development processes such as (SPICE/CMM/ASIL). Experience with AUTOSAR, Functional Safety or Cyber Security. Experience with industry standard software development tools: debuggers, code revision systems (GIT, Perforce), IDEs and build tools Skills Android, Automotive Spice, AUTOSAR, Embedded Software, Linux, QNX RTOS Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 4+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience. jobTitle: Automotive Telematics Software Program Manager (Senior or Staff)
jobDescription: Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Services Group, Engineering Services Group > Program Management General Summary Develops, defines, and executes plans of record, including: schedules, budgets, resources, deliverables, and risks. Monitors and drives the program from initiation through delivery, interfacing with internal and external stakeholders across functions on technical matters, as needed. Monitors budget/spending, on-time delivery, and achievement of program milestones. Represents the program and drives alignment across stakeholders. The Responsibilities Of This Role Include Working independently with little supervision. Making decisions that are significant in impact; errors are not readily apparent due to the complexity of work process/product or time between decisions and results; errors typically result in significant expenditure of time, resources, and funds to correct. Using verbal and written communication skills to convey complex and/or detailed information to multiple individuals/audiences with differing knowledge levels. May require strong negotiation and influence, communication to large groups or high-level constituents. Having a moderate amount of influence over key organizational decisions (e.g., is consulted by senior leadership to provide input on key decisions). Completing tasks that require multiple steps that can be performed in various orders; tasks require simultaneously executing multiple cognitive abilities and maintaining information in short- or long-term memory. Exercising exceptional creativity to innovate new ideas and develop innovative products/processes without established objectives or known parameters. Using deductive and inductive problem solving; multiple approaches may be taken/necessary to solve the problem; often information is missing or conflicting; advanced data analysis and interpretation skills are required. Occasionally participates in strategic planning within own area affecting immediate operations. The Responsibilities Of This Role Do Not Include Financial accountability (e.g., does not involve budgeting responsibility). Principal Duties & Responsibilities Collaborates with key stakeholders and program sponsors to develop program goals, set the prioritization of deliverables, discuss involvement of business processes (e.g., program change management, communication) and drives decisions necessary for on time delivery. Manages and takes responsibility for multiple medium sized programs/technology with moderate complexity by applying up-to-date program management knowledge to meet deadlines. Develops and manages the execution of the program Plan of Record (e.g., on time, on budget, within scope) for multiple medium sized programs which include schedule and resource forecasting, stakeholders identification, method and frequency of communication, scope, and prioritization. Establishes key program metrics and manages team to take action outside their comfort zone to ensure program success when metrics deviate from Plan of Record. Identifies and secures resources to ensure alignment of team with program/technology demand for multiple medium sized programs with moderate complexity. Drives teams to identify program issues/risks, and create a risk mitigation plan for multiple medium sized or a single complex program(s). Maintains and updates the risk tracker. Promotes program vision and objectives within the team, ensures program objectives are met or exceeded, presents program vision to management, and gains buy-in from stakeholders. Promotes adoption of processes by applying best practices and identifying and executing process improvement initiatives across the Program Management team. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related field. 4+ years Program Management experience or related work experience. 3+ years working with operating budgets, resources, and/or project financials. Preferred Qualifications Master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related field. 10+ years of Program Management or related work experience. 5+ years of work experience in a role requiring interaction with senior leadership (e.g., Director level and above). 3+ years of experience working in a large matrixed organization. 2+ years of experience with program management tools such as dashboards, Gantt charts, etc. Experience in software development in Automotive area and/or Board support Packages and/or Cellular Modem software. Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Software Engineering General Summary At Qualcomm, we are transforming the automotive industry with our Snapdragon Digital Chassis and building the next generation software defined vehicle (SDV). Snapdragon Ride is an integral pillar of our Snapdragon Digital Chassis, and since its launch it has gained momentum with a growing number of global automakers and Tier1 suppliers.  Snapdragon Ride aims to address the complexity of autonomous driving and ADAS by leveraging its high-performance, power-efficient SoC, industry-leading artificial intelligence (AI) technologies and pioneering vision and drive policy stack to deliver a comprehensive, cost and energy efficient systems solution.  Enabling safe, comfortable, and affordable autonomous driving includes solving some of the most demanding and challenging technological problems. From centimeter-level localization to multimodal sensor perception, sensor fusion, behavior prediction, maneuver planning, and trajectory planning and control, each one of these functions introduces its own unique challenges to solve, verify, test, and deploy on the road. We are looking for smart, innovative, and motivated individuals with strong SW background and programming experience in Python and C++. This position is, in the near-term, responsible for software development in a large-scale Python/C++ auto-labeling system for data from multiple sensors coming from our fleet of test vehicles. This auto-labeling system requires a high level of understanding about the world around the vehicle. To meet those needs, our team contributes state-of-the-art object, lane, and free space detection algorithms and software. Longer term, this position is planned to also include integrating some of these algorithms into the C++ drive stack. Job responsibilities include design, development, and testing of both Python and C++ software, with an emphasis on quality, automated testing, and best practices. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 2+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience. OR Master's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 1+ year of Software Engineering or related work experience. OR PhD in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field. 2+ years of experience with Programming Language such as C, C++, Java, Python, etc. Preferred Qualifications Experience with automated (unit/integration/regression) testing Experience with modern C++ (C++11 or higher) Experience with multi-threaded / multi-core SW development and design Experience with setting up, organizing, packaging, and testing large Python projects Knowledge/experience on developing in Linux environments Experience with safety critical software development/functional safety is a plus Ideal Candidate Will Have Familiarity with Python virtualenv-type tools Familiarity with CMake and GTest Experience with source code management tools such as git, git-lfs, github/gitlab Excellent written and verbal communication skills, ability to work with a cross-functional team Although this role has some expected minor physical activity, this should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Software Engineering General Summary At Qualcomm, we are transforming the automotive industry with our Snapdragon Digital Chassis and building the next generation software defined vehicle (SDV). We are looking for smart, innovative, and motivated individuals to join our behavior planning team. Applicants should have a strong theoretical background in deep reinforcement learning, experience in probabilistic planning algorithms, and good software implementation skills in Python and C++. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field. Preferred Qualifications Ph.D. + 2 years industry experience in behavior planning. Expert knowledge and implementation experience in deep reinforcement learning. 3+ years of experience with Programming Language such as C, C++, Python, etc. Experience working with, modifying, and creating advanced algorithms Analytical and scientific mindset, with the ability to solve complex problems. Experience with robust software design for safety-critical systems. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, ability to work with a cross-functional team. Job Responsibilities Include Research and develop novel algorithms to solve difficult problems related to behavior planning under uncertainty for autonomous driving Design driving policies for complex maneuvers in urban environments with many other agents Implement ideas in software (Python and C++) Work closely with prediction and motion planning teams on defining interfaces, requirements, and KPIs Work closely with test engineers to develop test plans for validating performance in simulations and real-world testing Although this role has some expected minor physical activity, this should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. Company Qualcomm Incorporated Job Area Interns Group, Interns Group > Interim Intern General Summary Before there were smartphones or smart cities, before autonomous cars or 360 virtual reality videos, there was our technology. Headquartered in San Diego, for over 30 years Qualcomm’s inventions have inspired others to make the impossible, possible. From 5G to artificial intelligence, IoT to automotive and extended reality applications, Qualcomm is inventing the technologies of an intelligently connected future, spearheading research efforts for the next global wireless standard, and collaborating with industry leaders in the wireless value chain to make this future a commercial reality. We are looking for bright and energetic students for great internship opportunities within Qualcomm’s Organizations for our 2023 Intern Class! Qualcomm’s Internship Program Our interns join world-class teams to help define and build what is next for mobility and the world.  You’ll be paired with a mentor with visibility to your project and team, receive support from your manager, and have access to the entire Qualcomm employee community to ensure your success. To round out your summer internship, we host professional development workshops, social events, cross-functional speaker sessions, and an executive speaker series. In addition to competitive hourly pay and accrued vacation time, you will receive relocation coverage and furnished housing accommodations for the duration of your internship. Minimum Qualifications Proficient with MS Office Suite including Excel, PowerPoint, and Word Strong written and verbal communication skills Strong interpersonal skills Must be in 3rd/junior year of undergraduate studies and graduating after 4th/senior year Must be available for 3 months during Summer 2023 (May-September) with a graduation date of December 2023 – June 2024 In study towards a bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Accounting, Economics. Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Operations Group, Operations Group > Business Operations General Summary We are looking for a Business Operations Manager with a strong background in data analytics, forecasting, demand management and reporting. The Business Operations Manager will primarily be responsible for managing the S&OP process for the Automotive Business Unit. Working in close partnership with key internal stakeholders, the position will lead efforts to generate a multiyear demand statement, define safety stock requirements, manage demand prioritization rules, and support allocation activities for constrained products. This position will require working with large and complex data sets, completing supply and demand analyses, and providing clear recommendations on ways to improve operational decisions and processes. Will need to proactively identify risks and ways to mitigate them through optimizing operational plan decisions. The position will work closely with the Automotive Business Unit to develop a strong understanding of the business strategy, commercial deal flow, and opportunity pipeline that will all help inform demand planning and operational decisions. A critical final output will be generating meaningful Tableau reporting for the Automotive Business Unit leadership to clearly understand the demand and supply situation across all products and customers. Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Machine Learning Engineering General Summary Be a part of the core team in Qualcomm’s industry-leading machine learning compilation and firmware system! Our extremely high performance and energy efficient machine learning system makes extensive use of C++ features. We interact closely with other cores and the operating system environment in interesting ways. We are looking for someone with broad and deep understanding of system software and who has a passion for high efficiency solutions. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or related field and 6+ years of Hardware Engineering, Software Engineering, Systems Engineering, or related work experience. OR Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or related field and 5+ years of Hardware Engineering, Software Engineering, Systems Engineering, or related work experience. OR PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or related field and 4+ years of Hardware Engineering, Software Engineering, Systems Engineering, or related work experience. Preferred Qualifications Preferred Qualifications:     Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or related field.     Extensive engineering experience in efficient and high-performance C++ development Concurrent programming including lock-free data structures Use of barriers, mutexes, semaphores, and other low-level concurrent programming primitives. Template metaprogramming and compile-time evaluation via constexpr. Domain-specific language implementations Code size sensitive applications Comfortable inspecting the output of the compiler (assembly language) for verifying performance or debugging performance issues     5+ years of experience with low level interactions between operating systems (e.g., Linux, Android, QNX) and Hardware, including: Knowledge of PCIe and CXL programming models Memory management, including dynamic manipulations of the virtual memory map High-performance, latency tolerant, user-space driver development for high-bandwidth peripherals such as Smart NICs and GPUs High-performance communication systems such as BD-rings Low-level synchronization primitives such as futexes, rendezvous, turnstyles, etc.     5+ years of extensive, deep experience with C, C++, and/or Rust Experience with Python Experience in developing compilers or compiler algorithms Detailed understanding of microarchitecture performance concerns such as branch prediction, cache misses, and optimization for multiple cores     3+ years of experience working in a highly independent fashion.     2+ years of work experience in a role requiring interaction with senior leadership (e.g., Director and above). Principal Duties And Responsibilities Understanding problems, experimentation, analysis of various solutions, and implementation of unique solutions to problems in a wide variety of subject areas Creation and performance tuning for shared memory communication structures, memory map manipulation, and other infrastructure Refactoring C++ code to improve performance, code size, or maintainability Functional and performance debugging in embedded environment Communication with others in the team to coordinate with other systems and share deep understanding of the ways it may impact the project. Experimentation and analysis of potential solutions Able to research and understand potential solutions already in the art, and synthesize similar solutions tailored to our needs. Stays abreast of current and future trends in system software, operating systems, and programming languages to make suggestions in strategic discussions within a domain about the product/technology roadmap. jobTitle: CAD – Custom Analysis Lead Engineer (CPU TEAM) - Austin OR Santa Clara OR San Diego
jobDescription: Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > CPU Engineering General Summary As a experience CAD Engineer focusing on transistor level timing and noise analysis tools, you will work with Design and Tech leads to ensure accurate and fast signoff of our designs. Roles And Responsibilities Take ownership of transistor level timing and noise characterization and analysis methodology for custom designs with focus on memories. Work with CAD and design leads to understand the design methodology and high level requirements in support of signoff analysis. Develop correlation and QA framework to ensure high quality design collaterals and tight correlation. Collaborate with team to develop build-analyze-validate-release flow for custom designs. Explore areas to support current or future designs that can benefit from automation and tooling to give better ROI. Preferred Qualifications MS degree in Computer Engineering; 10 years of practical experience Strong skills in driving multiple vendor’s signoff analysis tools including timing, noise, power, extraction using nanotime, liberate, siliconsmart, starrc/qrc. Strong skills in developing and supporting QA tools for liberty models using crossfire or other tools. Strong fundamentals in languages including python/perl/tcl/shell, automation, CAD infrastructure and flows. Good understanding of memory/custom designs. Experience with efficient visualization, dashboarding, log parsers is a plus. Comfortable working with design team partners to develop/test/deploy/debug Experience with signing off accuracy of analysis flows (compare to spice, foundry models, etc.) Although this role has some expected minor physical activity, this should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. jobTitle: CAD Engineer – AMS (Analog & Mixed-Signal) Simulation Flows & Methodology
jobDescription: Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > CPU Architecture General Summary As a member of our CAD team, you will architect, develop, maintain and enhance AMS (Analog/Mixed-Signal) simulation flows for our analog and mixed-signal designs. The role requires you to work with different technology nodes and provide flows and methodologies for major EDA tools including Cadence and Synopsis. You will be collaborating closely with design teams, EDA vendors and technology teams. Job Responsibilities Architect and drive the development of state-of-the-art mixed-signal simulation flows for Qualcomm's SoC teams. Develop AMS simulation automation for regression testing and porting across projects and technology nodes. Collaborate with EDA vendors to drive bug fixes, enhancements and drive future solutions to meet project demands. Solve AMS simulation and modeling issues with the design teams. Key Qualifications Proficient in using industry-standard mixed-signal simulation tools, including Cadence's AMS designer and Xcelium. Knowledge of Synopsis's VCS is a plus. Proficient with industry-standard SPICE and Fast-SPICE simulators like Spectre, APS, XPS, Synopsys CustomSim (XA)/HSPICE/Finesim, Mentor AFS. Strong understanding of behavioral and functional circuit description languages, including SystemVerilog, VerilogA, Verilog, Verilog-AMS. Experience with Real Number Modeling is appreciated. Experience with debugging AMS flows at netlisting, compilation, elaboration and simulation stages. Strong understanding of AMS simulation fundamentals: discipline resolution , Interconnect Element setup, Connect Modules, AMSD blocks, TCL probes, real number modeling, UDNs. Understanding of basics of custom IC designs and transistor modeling with BSIM and BSIM-CMG Ability to solve simulation performance issues ,accuracy, speed, and capacity. Experience with configuration and setting up batch and interactive simulation jobs with distributed compute grid such as LSF Good programming experience with SKILL and Python, TCL, UNIX Shell etc. Knowledge of the Virtuoso design framework, CDF, callbacks, Netlisting customization and PDK Proficient with Virtuoso ADE Explorer and Assembler customization and model integration Preferred Qualifications 10 years experience with MS / PhD in a technical field is preferred. Although this role has some expected minor physical activity, this should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. jobTitle: CAD IP QA Engineer (CPU TEAM) - Austin OR Santa Clara OR San Diego
jobDescription: Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > CPU Engineering General Summary Interested in joining the Qualcomm’s recently acquired Qualcomm CAD team as an IP QA CAD engineer? You will have the opportunity to work with some of the most talented and passionate engineers in the world to create designs that push the envelope on performance, energy efficiency and scalability. We offer a fun, creative and flexible work environment, with a shared vision to build products to change the world. As an IP QA Computer Aided Design (CAD) engineer, you will be responsible for the release and validation of all IPs (externally sourced and internally developed). In this role your tools and flows will ensure our IPs meet the highest quality standards for a flawless integration into our SOC designs. Qualifications BS degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science 5 years of experience in collateral generation, release and validation - either in a design or CAD role Expertise in industry-standard validation tools Proficiency in at least one of the following scripting languages - Tcl, Perl and Python Preferred Qualifications MS degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science Ten years of hands-on experience in IP development, release and validation for high performance designs - either in a design or CAD role Well versed with various views that constitute a hard-IP (Verilog, LEF, GDS, LIB, etc.) Deep expertise in industry-standard validation tools (CrossCheck, LEC, ESP-CV) Proven track record of managing and regressing collaterals High level of proficiency in Python. TCL/Perl knowledge will be good Experience in Custom Flow development or support will be a plus Database management and dashboarding experience will be a plus Roles and Responsibilities Build a robust, standardized IP release flow Develop, integrate and release new checks into the IP QA flow. Implement custom checks inhouse or using standard vendortool APIs. Gatekeeper for any IP releases to ensure highest quality delivery is achieved to minimize design churn and improve productivity. Be an excellent communicator. This role requires a lot of close collaboration with design teams, IP vendors Work with cross-functional teams - RTL design, custom design, physical design, DFT and methodology teams to define guidelines and best-practices to follow Develop a regression infrastructure to ensure all IPs are completely regressed prior to release. Develop an automated, self-service dashboard to manage release information. Recommend design and methodology improvements to ensure our silicon has the best power, performance and area Although this role has some expected minor physical activity, this should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Camera Engineering General Summary Qualcomm is a company of inventors that unlocked 5G ushering in an age of rapid acceleration in connectivity and new possibilities that will transform industries, create jobs, and enrich lives. This is the Invention Age - and this is where you come in as a Multimedia Imaging Implementation Engineer in the Camera/Imaging team. You will be joining one of the World's best Camera Design Solutions IP teams that delivers the Spectra ISP to various Snapdragon SoCs. A successful candidate will work on developing implementation infrastructure for Camera IP delivered to various SoCs. The candidate will be responsible for various functions from RTL integration through physical design. As a member of the Camera team, the successful applicant will help integrate, implement, and develop state of the art Camera cores and will be working closely with the Camera development and physical design teams. The successful candidate will possess understanding of ASIC design flow and the challenges posed by advanced deep sub-micron technologies. The Design Implementation Engineer will work in Qualcomm's Spectra Camera team and will be responsible for managing all aspect of front end implementation design. The role will also include working with execution driven teams for tape-outs by supporting new methodologies and new flows required to address better QoR like performance, power and area. The Responsibilities Will Include The Following RTL to GDS2 flow, tools and methodologies such as synthesis, static timing analysis, formal verification, physical design and ECO generation/verification Implementation and delivery of Camera cores from RTL to Netlist Identify areas for flow and process improvements RTL synthesis using physically aware tools Formal Verification using industry standard tools for RTL-netlist and netlist-netlist checks Close design timing by running static timing analysis and constraint development Generate and verify ECOs for functional and timing fixes, working closely with the physical design team Low Power synthesis flows for multiple corners Must Have Skills Bachelor's degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or closely related field 5+ years of experience with synthesis, static timing, timing closure, constraints and formal verification Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or related field and 4+ years of Software Engineering, Hardware Engineering, Systems Engineering, or related work experience. OR Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or related field and 3+ years of Software Engineering, Hardware Engineering, Systems Engineering, or related work experience. OR PhD in in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or related field and 2+ years of Software Engineering, Hardware Engineering, Systems Engineering, or related work experience. Preferred Qualifications Knowledge and experience of multimedia design and development Proficient in Perl, TCL, and shell scripting Hands on experience with front end EDA tools such as Synopsys Next Generation tools, Cadence Genus, Conformal LEC, Synopsys Formality and Synopsys PrimeTime Familiarity with the latest EDA tools for synthesis, logic equivalence checking, timing analysis, physical design. Able to problem solve complex, unique, and detailed issues. Although this role has some expected minor physical activity, this should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Operations Group, Operations Group > Product Management General Summary General Summary: Qualcomm is a company of inventors that unlocked 5G ushering in an age of rapid acceleration in connectivity and new possibilities that will transform industries, create jobs, and enrich lives. But this is just the beginning. It takes inventive minds with diverse skills, backgrounds, and cultures to transform 5Gs potential into world-changing technologies and products. This is the Invention Age - and this is where you come in. The Compute Chipset Product Management team is part of QCT's Product Management organization. The team manages the Windows on Snapdragon portfolio; the portfolio includes all Snapdragon products used for laptops, notebooks, all-in-one devices, etc. compute devices. The team’s objective is to synthesize and prioritize technical requirements, establish an overall compute product and technology portfolio strategy and roadmap to enable QCT to maintain overall technology, product, and business leadership. Development of the compute products and technology portfolio considers technology evolution, standardization initiatives and partnerships, evolution in device related engineering and testing processes as well as market/product requirements, opportunities, and competitive landscape. Principal Requirements And Responsibilities In-depth understanding of PC (Desktop, Laptop, All-In-One, Small Form Factor etc.) processor market – key processor vendors, OEMs, ODMs, channel partners etc. Direct a comprehensive PC / Laptop processor product strategy from product conception, definition and execution through end of life. Identifies gaps in PC market based on complex analyses of market, customer, technology, and other ecosystem demands and provides this information to guide design and definitions conversations. Strategizes and promotes use of new technologies, industry-leading trends and disruptive strategizes to gain Snapdragon share in laptop / desktops / all-in-one and other compute categories. Directs those involved in the design, modification, and evaluation of all phases of a specific product or group of products. Own PC processor product from beginning to end of the life - involvement lasts throughout all stages of a product’s lifecycle including modifications, upgrades, and maintenance of the product or product line. Leads team collaboration in the creation of business cases and validates cases for development of a new, complex product to ensure they are appropriate given business direction and asks appropriate questions to understand relevance of program to roadmap. Markets new and complex products and technologies through technical marketing opportunities such as conferences, congresses, and direct customer contact and drives product launch efforts. Prepares and delivers highly complex technical presentations regarding a product roadmap that explains and demonstrates products managed to customers. Translates customer feedback and external environment into potential changes for the differentiated product roadmap and communicates this to senior leaders – GM & EXC staff Directs and oversees the development of highly complex products or new products areas and services, independently; maintains communication with individuals across functional teams. Holds self and team(s) accountable for remaining up to date on competitors, technological advances, and the product ecosystem and taking the lead on development and design innovation of new and complex products to articulate differentiation of products to customer and identify trends. Communicates regularly with leadership following a communication plan to ensure cross-functional understanding of product plans for a product line. Ensures successful cross-functional collaboration by ensuring that agreed upon KPIs and specifications are met for a new, complex product(s), upon delivery by engineering team. Collaborates with key stakeholders and program sponsors to develop product goals (e.g., performance, cost, timeline, customer schedules), discuss product feasibility, and facilitate cross-functional decision making for products they own. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field. 10+ years PC Processors / Laptop Processors Product Management or related work experience. Preferred Qualifications 15+ years - PC Processors / Laptop Processors Product Management. In-depth experience of PC / Laptops semiconductor industry & ecosystem Direct experience as PC silicon Product Manager experience interacting with customers, device makers and ODMs Although this role has some expected minor physical activity, this should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > CPU Engineering General Summary Qualcomm is a company of inventors seeking to revolutionize the CPU market in an age of new possibilities. Are you interested in joining Qualcomm’s team as a Circuit RTL/DFT Modeling Engineer? You will have the opportunity to work with some of the most talented and passionate engineers in the world to create designs that push the envelope on performance, energy efficiency and scalability. We offer a fun, creative and flexible work environment, with a shared vision to build products to change the world. As a Circuit RTL/DFT Modeling Engineer, you will create functional and DFT models for various custom memories and other devices. You will also work with other teams to devise test plans and drive the functional verification of these circuits. Requirements BA/BS degree in Electrical Engineering with 3+ years of practical experience Proficiency with Verilog. Experience with memory design concepts. Experience with memory BIST concepts, implementations and tools. Experience in creating functional and behavioral models for custom IP. Preferred Qualifications MS degree in Electrical Engineering; 5+ years of practical experience Knowledge of Verilog and RTL simulation for functional verification of designs. Knowledge of memory redundancy schemes. Knowledge of DFT concepts and industry standard tools: Tessent, JTAG, Tetramax, MASIS, SMS, VRMC Experience with memory design. Experience with memory modeling. Roles And Responsibilities Create functional and behavioral models for custom memories and other circuits. Create DFT models for custom circuits and work with DFT engineers to define circuit test interfaces. These include memory BIST models, scan chain models, redundancy models, logical-to-physical mappings and other items related to the functionality and testability of custom IP. Create specifications, test plans and other documents. Verify circuit models through simulation and logical equivalence. Verify DFT collateral using vendor tools. Interact with AEs to resolve DFT or verification tool issues. Work with internal customers to support top level integration of DFT and functional models. Work with circuit designers to establish test strategies for new designs. Work with test engineers to resolve post-silicon test issues Although this role has some expected minor physical activity, this should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Software Engineering General Summary Cloud Software Developer We are looking for a talented, motivated, and experienced Cloud developers. As part of the IoT (Internet of Things) team you will be working on the next generation of IoT products. This role includes research and analysis of SW solutions for next generation IoT products. Develop prototypes and proof of concepts to evaluate incremental as well as radical new architectures. Develop SW components that are scalable, available, and secure. We are looking for talented and motivated team players who are passionate about software design and development. A Software Engineer In This Role Confers with systems analysts and engineers to design and to obtain information on project limitations and capabilities, performance requirements and interfaces. Stores, retrieves, and manipulates data for analysis of system capabilities and requirements. Uses scientific analysis and mathematical models to predict and measure outcomes and consequences of design. Design, develops, and deploys modular cloud-based systems and API. Develops and maintains cloud solutions in accordance with best practices. Ensures efficient functioning of data storage and processing functions in accordance with company security policies and best practices in cloud security. Uses modern web development and DevOps practices to develop, test, debug and deploy software. Uses the business process requirements to drive the detailed design of the application and technical architecture components. Configures, builds, and tests the application or technical architecture components. Works with other developers, designers, and architects to make sure that the configuration and custom components meet application requirements and performance goals. Anticipates, identifies, tracks, and resolves issues and risks affecting the delivery. Fixes any defects and performance problems discovered in testing. Participates in transitions of the application or technical architecture components to the Quality Engineers. Provides application/technical support as needed. Coordinates with and leverages offshore resources. Analyzes user needs and software requirements to determine the feasibility of design within time and cost constraints. Minimum Qualifications Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 2+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience. OR Master's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 1+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience. OR PhD in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field. 2+ years of experience with Programming Language such as C, C++, Java, Python, etc. Preferred Qualifications Proficiency with a modern server-side language such as C#, Java, Node or Python. Proficiency in JavaScript, jQuery, TypeScript, ES6, jQuery, JSON Experience with Cloud services and applications such as SaaS, PaaS, IaaS Experience working with leading infrastructure vendors such as AWS, Azure. Experience designing and building backend REST APIs using ASP.NET WebAPI or Django. Experience working with SQL databases such as SQL Server or MySQL. Experience working with NoSQL stores such as ElasticSearch, MongoDB, AWS S3, etc. Familiarity with microservice architecture patterns. Experience using version control systems such as Git / Perforce The Responsibilities Of This Role Do Not Include Financial accountability (e.g., does not involve budgeting responsibility). jobTitle: Competitive Performance & Power Analyst Santa Clara/Austin/Remote
jobDescription: Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > SoC Architecture General Summary Our mission is to reimagine silicon and create computing platforms that will transform the industry. You will have the opportunity to work with some of the most talented and passionate engineers in the world to create designs that push the envelope on performance, energy efficiency and scalability. As a competitive performance and power analyst, you will be working on CPU performance and power characterization, bring up industry-standard workloads and benchmarks for competitive analysis, create microbenchmarks to better understand competition, model competition’s future performance-power and trace workloads to feed the inhouse full-chip performance model. This work will influence the company’s future SoC roadmap. Roles And Responsibilities Collecting power-performance data for various CPU workloads / benchmarks Characterizing burst and sustained performance/power capabilities of systems Conducting detailed workload characterization and sensitivity analysis Writing micro-benchmarks to understand performance characteristics of a SoC Collect traces to feed the performance simulation model Build competitive performance prediction models Present the power-performance data in a concise manner Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field and 2+ years of Systems Engineering or related work experience. OR Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field and 1+ years of Systems Engineering or related work experience. OR PhD in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field. 2+ years of experience in one or more system architecture technology areas and products (e.g., Power System, Shared Resource Management, Limits/Thermal Management, Hardware Islands). Preferred Qualifications MS degree in Electrical / Computer Eng with 5 years of relevant experience Firm grasp of computer architecture and OS fundamentals Experience with characterizing industry standard benchmarks such as CPU2017, SpecJBB, PCMark, … Experience with hardware performance counter (PMU) and binary instrumentation tools Experience in writing micro-benchmarks to measure CPU power/performance characteristics Prior experience in tracing workloads to drive performance prediction models is a plus Experience with building competitive performance-power predictive models Knowledge of the competitive landscape, feature specifications and industry trends in the server and client domain Experience in Linux kernel internals / system programming Strong scripting skills -- Bash / Perl / Python Physical Requirements Frequently transports and install equipment up to 5 lbs. Performs required tasks at various heights (e.g. standing or sitting). Monitors and utilizes computers and test equipment for more than 6 hours a day. Continuous communication which includes the comprehension of information with colleagues, customers, and vendors both in person and remotely. The Reservoir Labs department in Qualcomm Corporate Research and Development is looking for Compiler Developers join our growing team. We work on developing new and innovative compilers that break the mold of current computing. We are tackling some of the most interesting and challenging problems in high performance computing, including designing compilers for high performance embedded computing systems, for machine learning, for advanced signal processing, extended reality (xR), and new paradigm changing applications. jobTitle: Computer Vision ASIC Design Engineer (San Diego/Santa Clara/Austin)
jobDescription: Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Video Systems, HW Architecture General Summary The Multimedia Computer Vision ASIC Design team at Qualcomm works on the design and development of complex IP Cores that can support cutting-edge Computer Vision applications. We are looking for strong ASIC Design Engineers who appreciate challenging work and would be responsible for: Implementation of advanced Computer Vision algorithms, such as: Feature Detection/Extraction, Object Detection, Machine Learning, Dense Motion Map, Depth Perception, deployed for various applications such Camera, AR, VR, and Automotive. Cross-team collaboration between Hardware/Systems/Firmware to gather requirements, formulate specifications and develop the IP Cores. Development of Micro-Architecture and RTL design that meets required performance and is optimized for Area and Power. Providing support to Verification teams for test-planning and BFM development. Debugging and root causing bugs caught during simulation/emulation and recommend/provide fixes. Reviewing reports for Linting, RTL Synthesis, CLP, CDC, and DV Coverage. Writing and maintaining thorough Design documents. Providing support for post-silicon debug. Effective communication across teams, multitasking and well-planned execution of the tasks. Principal Duties And Responsibilities Of This Role Include Design micro-architecture and its RTL implementation using Verilog / SystemVerilog HDL Design and Implementation targeting power, performance, area, and timing goals. Work with Design Verification team for functional/gate level verification and code coverage. Work on tools such as Linting, Power Artist, CDC and LEC, for checking design quality Education Minimum Qualifications Bachelors - Computer Engineering, Bachelors - Electrical Engineering Work Experience BS + 7 year / MS + 5 year of relevant industry experience. Capable of performing principal duties and responsibilities. Education Preferred Qualifications Masters/Doctorate - Computer Engineering, Masters - Electrical Engineering Work Experience 6+ years of industry experience ASIC or Logic Design, verification, or relevant work experience. 6+ years of industry experience with Verilog, SystemVerilog. 2+ years of recent experience with C/C++, Python/Perl. Experience covering Micro-architecture, RTL Design, Design timing/area/power optimizations, RTL synthesis. Some experience with Design Verification and Post-silicon debug. Experience with low-power and high throughput/performance RTL design. Experience with image/video compression and pixel processing. Knowledge of video standards like H.264, HEVC, AV1, or VVC. Familiarity with computer vision or machine learning algorithms and implementation. 2+ years of experience with leading a design block. Experience working in a multi-disciplinary, global team focused on advanced, high volume applications. jobTitle: Computer Vision ASIC Verification Engineer University Graduate (San Diego/Santa Clara/Austin)
jobDescription: Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Video Systems, HW Architecture General Summary As a Verification Engineer, you will be responsible for understanding the expected functionality of multimedia designs, specifically video encoder/decoder and CV hardware IP and subsystem. You will work with the architects of these multimedia systems, as well as multimedia ASIC designers and SW engineers to plan and execute verification and validation of multimedia subsystems for integration into SoCs for mobile applications. Location: San diego/Santa Clara/Austin Minimum Qualifications * Bachelor's/Master’s degree in Science, Engineering, or related field. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Computer or Electrical Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field. Preferred Qualifications Test planning, problem solving, debug, Verification of Multi-media hardware Strong working knowledge of HVLs: System Verilog, OO programming. Verilog , C/C++, Tcl/Perl/python/shell-scripting Experience with OVM/UVM methodology. Strong working experience in coverage driven constraint random verification. Experience in formal verification is plus Experience in building simulation acceleration environment is plus Prior experience in multi-media HW accelerator verification Video Codec, Machine learning IP Video codec knowledge H.264/MPEG/HEVC/VPx Principal Duties And Responsibilities Contributes to a specific video subsystem and develops basic features and components in line with product proposals or roadmaps; contributes to development of design/feature requirements with guidance from more experienced engineers. Uses appropriate tools and methodology to assist in conducting analyses (e.g., feasibility studies) of video hardware/system design with supervision. Understands complexity and quality of specific video component or design based on device specifications and requirements. Collaborates with members of design engineering teams and senior engineers to identify basic video hardware/system testing needs with supervision from more experienced engineers. Writes technical documentation and feature descriptions for straightforward projects under the direction of a supervisor. Level Of Responsibility Working under close supervision. Taking responsibility for own work and making decisions with limited impact; impact of decisions is readily apparent; errors made typically only impact timeline (i.e., require additional time to correct). Using verbal and written communication skills to convey basic, routine factual information about day-to-day activities to others who are fully knowledgeable in the subject area. Working within prescribed budget and resources. Completing some tasks with multiple steps which must be performed in a specific order; directions or manuals can accurately document the steps necessary to perform the task. Exercising some creativity to troubleshoot technical problems or deal with novel circumstances. Limited problem solving required, generally in the nature of troubleshooting simple processes or technology. The Responsibilities Of This Role Do Not Include Providing supervision/guidance to others. Influence over key organizational decisions. Role in strategic planning.
