jobTitle: Senior Program Manager – Artificial Intelligence (AI) Research
jobDescription: Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Services Group, Engineering Services Group > Program Management General Summary The AI Research Program Management team has an immediate opening for a Senior Program Manager to work with technical leadership to manage software tools and technology deliverables from our AI research programs. The ideal candidate has technical experience in developing and delivering software and enjoys working with an entrepreneurial team of researchers whose work is impacting the AI research and open-source community. The ideal candidate will be able to leverage their software engineering background to proactively manage the deliverables of a team of engineers in their development of various tools targeted to support new platforms and services. At Qualcomm, program managers must be technically proficient in their field(s). Many Program Managers have advanced technical degrees and count on these skills to drive successful projects. We need a highly motivated quick learner individual with AI/NN experience looking to expand scope and breadth of responsibility, that enjoys working in a high-energy environment, with some of the smartest researchers in power-efficient AI. If you enjoy seeing the results of your strong engineering, communication, and organizational skills supporting the goals of Qualcomm’s AI research and its intersection with customers and the open-source community, this job is for you. Duties Include The Following Coordinate the work of the AI-based software tools research and development team in partnership with engineering leads by establishing schedules, task assignments, and tracking tasks. Establish and manage a plan of record (POR) and work with engineering leads to prioritize deliverables Coordinate with commercial PMO (Project Management Office) and engineering teams for transfer of technologies and features Develop and maintain program progress dashboards including disciplined tracking of information and risks. Translate the organizational strategy and evolving software roadmaps into successful programs, and drive decisions necessary for program delivery by partnering with stakeholders and leadership. Organize and lead inter-team meetings, to review program tasks to ensure resources are allocated as planned Ensure change control, priority changes, reviews, and other software development processes are effectively implemented. Support technical leads in organizing and leading scrums, standing team meetings and status reports Support team activities at academic conferences such as demo development and workshop participation Work with Program Management leadership to ensure best practices are applied and that program organization adheres to organization objectives and strategy. Identify and recommend process improvement opportunities across various corporate systems supporting or impacting the research organization Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related field. 4+ years of Program Management or related work experience. 3+ years of working with operating budgets, resources, and/or project financials. Ideal Candidates Will Demonstrate The Following Bachelors Degree - Computer Science, Bachelors - Engineering 5+ years of engineering experience in areas of software development e.g., embedded SW (software), open-source software, application, or libraries 3+ years Engineering Lead/ Program Management experience or related work experience. 1+ years working with project dashboards and Gannt charts etc. Preferred Qualifications Include Quick learner: ability to adapt in a dynamic environment Self-starter: proficient in owning decisions and driving outcomes Experience with leading or contributing to AI projects Experience with collaboration, communication with internal and external teams (e.g., Status reporting) Masters Degree- Computer Science, Masters - Engineering Other Skills Include Microsoft (Teams, PowerPoint, Project, Excel, SharePoint) Atlassian (Confluence, Jira) Although this role has some expected minor physical activity, this should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Services Group, Engineering Services Group > Program Management General Summary The Program Manager will be part of the Visual Technology Program Management team, providing a full line of Camera/Video/Computer-Vision solutions to the Snapdragon family of products. Duties include the following: Responsible to deliver Computer Vision IP across QCT Products for Mobile, Auto, XR, and IoT BU Responsible for complex semiconductors device program execution in terms of schedule, performance, area, power, and cost Risk management and disciplined management of information to internal and external key stakeholders Ensures change control, development reviews, and other product development processes are effectively implemented Initiate and support DFMEA processes Work with the FW team to manage FW releases to SW for POR features and manage any subsequent additional feature requests For Automotive products, ensure ASIL compliance throughout the duration of the project including technical reviews with product teams. Manage and track project deliverables to functional safety standards, where applicable. Roll up and report regularly to senior management on key product development milestones, metrics, risks, risk mitigation plans, and staffing status Works closely with product marketing, Technology Core teams, ASIC design implementation teams, Test project engineers, Systems, Software, and other leads and program managers to ensure successful and timely delivery of a quality product Coordinate delivery of engineering products according to agree to specifications, budget, and schedule. Coordinate internal department schedules, resources, etc. and develops master schedule, work plans, checklists, design reviews, and resource requirements. Organize and lead interdepartmental meetings, to set project milestones, define project tasks, establish program policies and processes and allocate resources. Troubleshoot program issues and help develop alternative program tasks, schedules, milestones, resource plans, processes, etc. to resolve program issues and conflicts. Participate in design reviews and ensure compliance to design or department checklists and procedures. Take an active role in innovating and improving the current program management metrics and processes. Minimum Qualifications 5+ years of relevant experience in planning & managing digital design projects Experience in digital integrated circuit or core design, digital IC architecture, and product development with a later career emphasis on program management of those disciplines. Experience with multi-tasking to understand/facilitate/guide a variety of disciplines such as System Architecture and modeling, IC digital design, verification and implementation, SW/FW drivers, project and product management. Experience in complete ASIC lifecycle development. Understanding of complex technical project execution, and ability to communicate the issues and solutions to all levels of the organization Ability to extract the right information from the right people. Track record of proven leadership, business and program management performance Microsoft tools like mpp, advanced excel, PowerPoint. Preferred Qualifications Experience and background in Multimedia/Visual Technologies. Self-starter. Ability to manage, influence, and set direction of multi-faceted, multi-disciplined teams and programs independently with minimal supervision. Ability to articulate vision and influence decision making and outcomes both within internal and with external teams through effective communication skills at all levels. Capable of synchronizing and motivating other program managers, product management and engineering leads to attain common goal Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related field. 4+ years of Program Management or related work experience. 3+ years of working with operating budgets, resources, and/or project financials. jobTitle: Senior Staff Software Engineer (Project Engineer) - Windows Products on Snapdragon on Snapdragon
jobDescription: Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Software Engineering General Summary Looking for an experienced software engineer for project engineering role on Windows on Snapdragon desktop products. As a software project engineer, you'll be owning and driving complex system feature architecture and development including constraints of live update to infield devices. You will also need to evaluate conflicting OEM requested features with OS partner roadmaps to drive implementation as needed for mutual success. You will be working closely with software architects, OS and kernel developers, Qualcomm Customer engineering, and various external partner technology teams. Ideal candidate has experience with Windows OS, BIOS/UEFI, Windows device drivers, Microsoft WHCP/HLK test criteria, Windows Update system/processes as well as Windows development tools such as Visual Studio, WinDebug, T32, and Perforce. A key skill is to identify technical gaps and then create and implement a resolution plan. Looking for a self-starter, with excellent people and leadership skills to drive delivery of features and systems with senior technical members from a broad set of teams across Qualcomm and external partners. Should be able to self-manage and work through ambiguous technical issues and requirements. Ability to work with technical leads, product managers, and program management to establish requirements, LOE, resourcing, development and test phases, and timeline to product intercept. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Hybrid work option in San Diego location. Responsibilities Identify and manage feature requests for architecture and implementation to meet OEM needs in accordance with Windows requirements and Windows update processes Work with Product Management and Customer Engineering for technical depth understanding and communication to OEM’s on issues and features as needed Work with external partners on initiatives, feature implementations for development and product intercepts Coordinate across QC tech teams as needed for multi-team feature success Understand and work with internal and external teams to drive feature delivery in the interest of Windows on Snapdragon Compute Identify and manage internal process gaps and drive closure to help the Windows on Snapdragon development ecosystem Skills And Experience Experienced in C/C++, ARM assembly, Jtag, WinDebug Familiarity with SOC ARM architecture, Windows Compute systems, DSP subsystems, PCIe, I2C, USB, Thunderbolt, HDMI, HW/SW DRM, TPM Familiarity with System BIOS, UEFI, and ACPI Experience with Windows OS, Visual Studio, Windows device drivers, Microsoft WHCP/HLK test criteria, Windows Update system/processes Awareness and understanding of Windows Platform Enabling guide, OEM/ODM product development flow Able to identify and isolate complex problems across multiple layers of hardware, OS, compiler, and drivers for effective triage or tasking Self-starter and able to work on tasks with ambiguous requirements Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 6+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience. OR Master's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 5+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience. OR PhD in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 4+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience. 3+ years of experience with Programming Language such as C, C++, Java, Python, etc. Although this role has some expected minor physical activity, this should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. All Qualcomm employees are expected to actively support diversity on their teams, and in the Company. OR Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or related field and 1+ year of Hardware Engineering, Software Engineering, Systems Engineering, or related work experience. OR PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or related field. You Will Be Expected To Demonstrate The Following 3+ years Windows software development experience Experience with Windows application development (e.g. working on tutorials/examples and validating integration into Windows stack) Software development experience using C/C++ Strong software development skills (e.g. data structure and algorithm design, object oriented or other software design paradigm knowledge, software debugging and testing, etc.) Strong communication skills (verbal, presentation, written) Preferred Qualifications Experience with ONNX RT Experience with different NN architectures DNNs, CNNs, RNNs/LSTMs, GANs, etc. Linux software development Experience with FastRPC/MCDM drivers Software development experience with Python Ability to collaborate across a globally diverse team and multiple interests Although this role has some expected minor physical activity, this should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Multimedia Systems General Summary Qualcomm is a leading innovator in System-on-Chip (SoC) solutions for mobile communications and multimedia technologies, AR/VR and wearable devices, IoT as well as automobile. Qualcomm is looking for a Sensor System Design Engineer who will drive architecture and design of novel biosensors for continuous health monitoring applications. This is an exciting opportunity to develop breakthrough health monitoring technologies. We are looking for a motivated, self-directed systems engineer with experience in architecting new sensing technologies. The candidate will systematically develop and explore feasibility of new sensors using multi-physics modeling, build custom characterization test beds and perform data analysis to achieve high-confidence design and down-selection. This position requires a background in sensor design, especially multiphysics simulations involving optics, ultrasonics, piezoelectric and other type of sensors. The position also requires sensor characterization and data analysis, developing performance metrics and performance optimization. The successful candidate will contribute to system level design, and optimization of novel healthcare sensors based on photoacoustics and ultrasound. They will work closely with Qualcomm Hardware, Process/prototyping, Algorithm, and Software Engineers at several Qualcomm sites. Design sensors spanning across multiple physics domains: photoacoustics, optics, ultrasonics/acoustic, piezoelectric, electrical, thermal, and mechanical. Define sensor system architecture, key figures of merit, identifying the tradeoffs on system level. Reduced order modelling: KLM, equivalent circuit, BPM. Multiphysics modeling techniques: optics (ray tracing and scattering), ultrasonics, piezoelectricity, structural, fluid mechanics, electrical. Develop sensor design/modelling workflow. Validate models against experimental data. Develop characterization methods, metrics and methodology to quantify performance improvement. Characterize performance of various sensor configurations and down-select designs. Propose and evaluate innovative ideas for performance enhancements. Provide technical reports and design documents. Basic Qualifications- 2+ years of related hands-on design experience in sensors and systems or Ph.D degree. Experience with sensor modeling, fabrication processes, and characterization. Strong sensor fundamentals with experience in photoacoustics or ultrasonics or optics or MEMS or piezoelectric sensors and actuator or other biomedical sensors. Experience with multi-physics analysis tools (FEA tools like ANSYS, COMSOL, OnScale, Optical simulations tools like ZEMAX etc.) Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and a track record of innovation. Strong experimental/characterization skills and experience with MATLAB/PYTHON. Proficient with electrical, ultrasonic, optical, mechanical, thermal test equipment and experience with test automation. Experience with piezoelectric transducers based on PVDF, PZT and PZT composites, and VCSELs and other optical component is preferred. Good communication skills to allow effective cooperation with a global development team. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 2+ years of Systems Engineering or related work experience. OR Master's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 1+ year of Systems Engineering or related work experience. OR PhD in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field. Works in the lab, can use hazardous chemicals (e.g., glue, machinery). Although this role has some expected minor physical activity, this should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. jobTitle: SOC DV Engineer San Diego/Austin/Santa Clara
jobDescription: Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > ASICS Engineering General Summary As a fresh graduate, you will get exposure to a complex server SoC being developed from scratch. You will get to interact with a small team of very seasoned engineers with a great opportunity to learn and grow in the latest technologies and industry standard verification techniques like UVM/SVA/Formal. We have an open and collaborative culture where each and every one of us, regardless of our experience, is made to feel welcome and participate actively to innovate and build the best high performance computing SoCs. As a SOC Design Verification Engineer you will help set up methodologies, come up with test plans, and verify the design meets the highest quality standards. We believe in early involvement of DV, so you will also participate in architecture/product definition through early involvement in the product life-cycle. Roles and Responsibilities Work with design team and DV leads to understand design intent and execute test plans Debug test cases and report verification result to achieve expected code/functional coverage goal Verify SoC using advanced verification methodologies Build agents and checkers from scratch or add features to existing ones Assist in emulation, FPGA, prototyping efforts Assist in silicon bring-up, debug and characterization Minimum Qualifications Bachelors - Computer Science/Electronics/Electrical Engineering Preferred Qualifications MS degree in Electrical Engineering with focus on VLSI/ASIC/SoC Design Strong fundamentals in digital design; experience using Verilog or VHDL Strong programmable language experience is required (one or more of Verilog, SystemVerilog, Perl, Python, Tcl Scripts, Makefile and/or C, C++) Domain knowledge and or relevant course-work in Computer Architecture, Cross-Connects, Memories, High speed interfaces/protocols, SoC/FPGA/ASIC Verification and Testing Work Experience Desired, but not needed Although this role has some expected minor physical activity, this should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > SoC Architecture General Summary Our mission is to reimagine silicon and create computing platforms that will transform the industry. You will have the opportunity to work with some of the most talented and passionate engineers in the world to create designs that push the envelope on performance, energy efficiency and scalability. As a SoC Performance Architect, you will be responsible for end-to-end performance of the SoC components such as fabrics / memory controller / IO. This would entail creating detailed performance and power models, validating the model, identifying + prototyping ideas to improve performance, debugging performance problems and working with architects to shape future SoC design. Role And Responsibilities Develop a SoC performance/power model that encompasses blocks such as interconnects, coherency controllers, distributed caches, memory controllers, IO controllers Verify model correctness by writing unit-tests and debugging mismatches against expectations Conduct detailed studies and identify avenues for improving the SoC’s performance/power characteristics. Prototype ideas and quantify the benefit. Work with architects, RTL developers to productize the improvements identified through detailed studies Verify that the RTL and Silicon performance correlates with the model; debug mismatches and refine the model when needed Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field and 4+ years of Systems Engineering or related work experience. OR Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field and 3+ years of Systems Engineering or related work experience. OR PhD in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field and 2+ years of Systems Engineering or related work experience. 2+ years of experience in one or more system architecture technology areas and products (e.g., Power System, Shared Resource Management, Limits/Thermal Management, Hardware Islands). Preferred Qualifications MS or PhD in Computer Science/Computer Engineering/Electrical Engineer with 5 years of experience in CPU / SoC performance/power modeling, analysis / debug Expertise in one or more of these functional areas: Coherent fabrics based on the AMBA CHI / AXI protocol Memory controller designs for LPDDR5, DDR5, HBM IO controllers and fabric bridges for PCIe / CXL / CCIX Strong grasp of the computer architecture fundamentals especially in the areas of interconnects, traffic QoS, distributed caches, coherency flows, DRAM controller and IO (PCIe) flows Experience in building fast, accurate SoC / CPU performance models in C / C++ Demonstrable experience in productizing features that improve performance/power characteristics of a design Exposure to testing and debugging performance issues in pre- and post-silicon environments Strong in C / C++ and scripting languages like Python / Perl; familiarity with Verilog Physical Requirements Frequently transports and install equipment up to 5 lbs. Performs required tasks at various heights (e.g. standing or sitting). Monitors and utilizes computers and test equipment for more than 6 hours a day. Continuous communication which includes the comprehension of information with colleagues, customers, and vendors both in person and remotely. jobTitle: Software Engineer – Backend (Wayne, Boston, and San Diego)
jobDescription: Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Software Engineering General Summary In a team environment, designs, implements, and maintains backend software systems which support a sophisticated and innovative service designed to help mobile, IOT and other devices determine their geo-location. These systems include API services written in Java, Python, and other languages, as well as data processing pipelines which leverage Scala, Spark, machine learning, and other technologies commonly used to support the processing of very large amounts of data. All systems are deployed to the cloud, using the latest cloud-based services and technologies. Works closely with researchers and analysists to design, validate, and implement sophisticated, proprietary algorithms. Works closely with QA engineers to verify quality and correctness, and with dev/ops engineers to deploy software to the cloud. Preferred Skills 2+ years of experience writing and maintaining a large Java codebase 2+ years of experience writing code in a standard scripting language, such as Bash, Perl, or Python 2+ years of experience with common database software (e.g., MySQL, Postgres) 2+ years of experience developing API services 2+ years of experience developing systems deployed via cloud services (e.g., AWS, Azure) 2+ years of development experience in a Linux environment 2+ years of experience using Git to manage changes to a large codebase 2+ years of experience using standard bug tracking and documentation platforms (e.g., JIRA, Confluence) Good understanding of object-oriented programming (OOP) methods Good understanding of networking concepts, including the TCP/IP protocol Good understanding of standard data structures and algorithms, including basic concepts of run-time analysis Good understanding of multi-threaded programming concepts Excellent verbal and written communication skills Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field. Qualcomm is committed to hiring and supporting individuals with disabilities. Although this role has some expected physical activity, an inability to perform one or more of the listed physical requirements should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. We will work with you throughout the application and onboarding process to provide reasonable accommodations. Examples of expected physical activity include: frequently transporting between offices, buildings, and campuses up to ½ mile; frequently transporting and installing equipment up to 5 lbs; performing tasks at various heights (e.g., standing or sitting); monitoring and utilizing computers and test equipment for more than 6 hours a day; and continuous communication which includes the comprehension of information with colleagues, customers, and vendors both in person and remotely. Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Systems Test Engineering General Summary Tests and modifies general systems-level software/hardware, specialized utility and/or hardware. Interprets wireless specifications. Designs test plans, scenarios, scripts, or procedures. Documents systems-level defects, using a bug tracking system, and report defects to developers. Identifies, analyzes, troubleshoots, and documents problems with program function, output, or content. Develops testing programs that assess effectiveness of a new system or modification of an existing system. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 4+ years of Systems Test Engineering or related work experience. OR Master's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 3+ years of Systems Test Engineering or related work experience. OR PhD in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 2+ years of Systems Test Engineering or related work experience. Preferred Qualifications Develop a simulation environment for Advanced Driving Assistance Systems (ADAS) and Autonomous Driving Systems (ADS) for internal feature teams (customers) Develop a harmonized and flexible simulation platform which can be used in various tools and different test methods (e.g. re-processing, open- and closed-loop simulation in HiL and SiL) Create HiL Framework Integrate the solution to the feature pipelines for continuous development and integration purpose (CI/CD) Develop environments for automated testing. Domain expertise in Autonomous Driving, feature integration. Ideal candidate will have - Very good programming skills, especially in MATLAB, C++ and Python, Linux Deep knowledge and expertise in HiL (Hardware in Loop) Relevant experience with - automotive test methods, reprocessing and simulation - Simulation Tools (e.g. dSPACE ASM) - dSPACE tooling (e.g. VEOS, AutomationDesk, ConfigurationDesk) CI/CD - ADAS, ADS, sensor physics and modeling. Experience in building pipeline in Cloud – AWS or Azure or Google cloud platform Preferred: Knowledge of respective standards (e.g. FMU/FMI, ASAM Simulation Standards) Although this role has some expected minor physical activity, this should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. jobTitle: Software Engineer - Augmented, Mixed and Virtual Reality
jobDescription: Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Software Engineering General Summary Qualcomm is a leading provider of hardware and software solutions for Augmented, Mixed, and Virtual Reality, aka eXtended Reality (XR), platforms. Qualcomm is a also a company of inventors that unlocked 5G, ushering in an age of rapid acceleration in connectivity and new possibilities that will transform industries, create jobs, and enrich lives. Qualcomm is taking its traditional strengths in digital wireless technologies into the world of XR. XR has the power to completely change the way we interact with people and things and we want you to take on this challenge and make a lasting impact on our lives. If you enjoy solving hard challenges, you enjoy designing systems that can employ your solutions, and you enjoy seeing these systems make it to products in consumers’ hands, we invite you to join Qualcomm’s world-class XR team in San Diego, California. You will get to interact closely with system engineers, and software and hardware developers and enjoy life in sunny San Diego on the Pacific coast of California. Be part of a team of strong technology developers building mobile Augmented, Mixed, and Virtual Reality technology Collaborate across functional boundaries in defining architecture, APIs, design and schedule Design and deliver key technologies and tools to make XR experiences performant and power optimized Enable key partners build and deploy world class XR solutions All Qualcomm employees are expected to actively support diversity on their teams, and in the Company. Skills/experience Preferred qualifications: 1+ years’ experience with programming languages such as C, C++, Java, Python, etc. Knowledge and inclination towards practical use of Machine Learning techniques. Minimum qualifications: Entry-level Software Engineering or related work experience with inclination towards software design and development Responsibilities: Software design, development, testing and documentation of key software features for XR use cases. Education requirements: Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related field Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field. Preferred Qualifications 1+ year of experience with Programming Language such as C, C++, Java, Python, etc. 1+ year of experience with Database Management Software. 1+ year of experience with API. 1+ year of experience working in a large matrixed organization. Principal Duties And Responsibilities Communicates issues with team lead and peers. Adapts to changes and setbacks in order to meet deadlines. Communicates with project lead to provide status and information about impending obstacles. Collaborates with others inside project team to accomplish project objectives. Gathers, integrates, and interprets information specific to a module or sub-block of code from a variety of sources in order to troubleshoot issues and find solutions. Collaborates with individuals within domain to complete the team's work. Stays focused and deals with setbacks in a timely manner. Seeks out learning opportunities to increase own knowledge and skill. Completes assigned coding tasks to specifications on time without significant errors or bugs. Resolves straightforward software issues and bugs within a reasonable amount of time. Actively seeks answers for new challenges. Prioritizes project deadlines and deliverables with close supervision. Is receptive to others' suggestions about ways in which a problem can be addressed differently. Escalates technical issues to an appropriate party (e.g., project lead, colleagues). Networks with colleagues within domain to gain insight, ideas, and connections. Level Of Responsibility Working under close supervision. Taking responsibility for own work and making decisions with limited impact; Impact of decisions is readily apparent; errors made typically only impact timeline (i.e., require additional time to correct). Using verbal and written communication skills to convey basic, routine factual information about day-to-day activities to others who are fully knowledgeable in the subject area. Completing most tasks with multiple steps which can be performed in various orders; some planning and prioritization must occur to complete the tasks effectively; mistakes may result in some rework. Exercising some creativity to troubleshoot technical problems or deal with novel circumstances. Using deductive problem solving to solve moderately complex problems; most problems have defined processes of diagnosis/detection; some limited data analysis may be required. The Responsibilities Of This Role Do Not Include Financial accountability (e.g., does not involve budgeting responsibility). Influence over key organizational decisions. Role in strategic planning. Although this role has some expected minor physical activity, this should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Software Engineering General Summary Qualcomm is hiring multiple software engineers at Senior and Staff level to help architect and build its next generation data processing platform to support Autonomous Driving R&D efforts. Our goal is to design and build a highly scalable, efficient, and modular data platform. This platform will be used by engineers to run re-simulation pipelines, machine learning workloads, perform in-depth data analysis/analytics, visualize results, and more. Excellent communication and planning skills are critical in this role as we'll be working with internal teams and external partners. Responsibilities For This Position Include Work with team leads to understand use cases and requirements Build proof-of-concepts to validate proposed designs and provide feedback Implement data management systems, data pipelines, and highly scalable distributed processing services used for autonomous driving research and development Drive software engineering best practices within immediate and external teams Support users of the platform Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 4+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience. OR Master's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 3+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience. OR PhD in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 2+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience. 2+ years of experience with Programming Language such as C, C++, Java, Python, etc. Preferred Qualifications 3 to 20 years of relevant experience in a software development role (or equivalent). Industry experience in designing and implementing scalable solutions used for Autonomous Driving R&D applications. Experience with building data pipelines and workflow management tools such as Airflow, Prefect, Argo or Cloud native technologies like AWS Batch, Azure Data factory. Familiarity using a programming language such as Python, Go, C/C++, Java, or Scala Hands-on experience using managed services from one or more of the major cloud vendors: AWS, GCP, Azure Experience working with distributed processing frameworks such as Spark, Hadoop, Hive, or other Apache Foundation frameworks. Understanding of RDBMS, NoSQL DB technologies, and data warehousing solutions and tradeoffs Experience in Cloud technologies like S3, databases and so on. Experience in designing, developing, testing, and deploying data integrations in the cloud. Experience with containerized platforms like docker and Kubernetes. Company Arriver Software, LLC Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Software Engineering General Summary The Ground truth team perceives everything the autonomous car does; but better! As a Software Engineer, you have overall responsibility for contributing to the software which understands the world, and enables the verification of in-car algorithms. This includes object tracking, lane tracking, state estimation, localization, and mapping. What You'll Do Help architect and add to a ground truth software suite Develop state-of-the-art algorithms to build up a hyper-accurate world model Contribute to a team wide codebase in Python, C++ and MATLAB Use classical techniques to fuse and utilize complementary deep learning algorithms Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field. Preferred Qualifications Experience with SLAM, tracking algorithms or similar. Experience with Linux and cross-built applications Experience programming and running C++ Experience using Multithreading or CUDA Good interpersonal skills and ability to work independent or as a team Tools & Technology Experience with Agile Docker Servers and orchestrators (Kubernetes, Slurm, Jenkins, etc.) Databases (SQL and NoSQL) as well as common APIs Git/Gerrit Although this role has some expected minor physical activity, this should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. Company Qualcomm Innovation Center, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Software Engineering General Summary We are looking for a talented, motivated and experienced Software Engineer with expertise in Linux/Android internals. This role includes software design and development, debugging and testing Linux/Android software. You will work on various technologies areas in Android - Audio, Bluetooth, Connectivity, UI etc. in the Framework and application layers. Development/testing will involve enabling new end to end use cases on Android in peer to peer connectivity and inter-device connectivity. You will interact with various internal cross-functional teams as well as third party OEMs designing, developing and testing on new features that are scalable, performant and power optimized. This position is with Qualcomm's fully-owned subsidiary, the Qualcomm Innovation Center (QuIC). QuIC is focused on open source software development and participates in the open source community. Job Responsibilities Design, implement and drive new Android framework/UI features on Android platform. Debug and fix complex problems involving multiple modules from Android UI/framework, middleware to interface layers to hardware Implement Tools and Test applications to enable and streamline testing process. Contribute in pre-silicon and post-silicon bring-up of future chipsets. The Ideal Candidate Will Have The Following Experiences/Skills C /C++ and JAVA programming skills and a good understanding of Data Structures and Algorithms Object Oriented Design and Programming Android Software Development Debugging skills in C/C++ and Java using debugging tools like GNU tools or Android Studio Experience in Bluetooth LE and Android Frameworks development Experience with Java-JNI, Inter-Process Communication and Makefiles. Experience using git for development; patch/tree management ARM processors and/or embedded software development on mobile devices Excellent communication, interpersonal, and teamwork skills Independent and motivated problem solver. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 2+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience. OR Master's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 1+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience. OR PhD in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field. 2+ years of experience with Programming Language such as C, C++, Java, Python, etc. Qualcomm is committed to hiring and supporting individuals with disabilities. jobTitle: Software Engineer - Mobile (Wayne, Boston, and San Diego)
jobDescription: Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Software Engineering General Summary In a team environment, our mobile software engineers design, implement, and maintain client software library and SDK components which support a sophisticated and innovative service designed to help mobile, IOT and other devices determine their geolocation. These components are written in Java, Kotlin, and C/C++, and support a variety of platforms, including Android, AOSP, Linux, and various desktop and IoT/embedded operating systems. Efficient use of device resources, including memory, CPU cycles, power, and network bandwidth are all critical elements of these software components. Team members work closely with researchers, analysts, and QA engineers to design, implement, and validate sophisticated, proprietary algorithms, and have a solid understanding of computer science and software engineering fundamentals, including network protocols, data structures and algorithms, multithreading, object-oriented design, source code management, and software lifecycle best practices. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field. Preferred Qualifications At least 2 years of experience in mobile development Object-oriented and functional programming paradigms Collaborative peer code reviewing using an online system like GitHub Agile development Good working knowledge of Git concepts and workflows Facility using JIRA/Confluence, or similar issue tracking and collaborative documentation systems Excellent verbal and written communication skills 5 years of software development experience (including 2 years in Mobile) Multithreaded software architecture and design Networking fundamentals Standard algorithm fundamentals Synchronous and asynchronous processing flow and dispatch mechanisms In depth knowledge of Java, C, and C++ and their use in battery efficient and highly performant mobile clients Capable of designing and building applications for Android. Working knowledge of associated development tools. Experience with Kotlin is a plus Experience using principles of Test Driven Development (TDD) Qualcomm is committed to hiring and supporting individuals with disabilities. Although this role has some expected physical activity, an inability to perform one or more of the listed physical requirements should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. We will work with you throughout the application and onboarding process to provide reasonable accommodations. Examples of expected physical activity include: frequently transporting between offices, buildings, and campuses up to ½ mile; frequently transporting and installing equipment up to 5 lbs; performing tasks at various heights (e.g., standing or sitting); monitoring and utilizing computers and test equipment for more than 6 hours a day; and continuous communication which includes the comprehension of information with colleagues, customers, and vendors both in person and remotely. Although this role has some expected minor physical activity, this should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. jobTitle: Software Engineer - Mobile (Wayne, Boston, and San Diego)
jobDescription: Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Software Engineering General Summary In a team environment, our mobile software engineers design, implement, and maintain client software library and SDK components which support a sophisticated and innovative service designed to help mobile, IOT and other devices determine their geolocation. These components are written in Java, Kotlin, and C/C++, and support a variety of platforms, including Android, AOSP, Linux, and various desktop and IoT/embedded operating systems. Efficient use of device resources, including memory, CPU cycles, power, and network bandwidth are all critical elements of these software components. Team members work closely with researchers, analysts, and QA engineers to design, implement, and validate sophisticated, proprietary algorithms, and have a solid understanding of computer science and software engineering fundamentals, including network protocols, data structures and algorithms, multithreading, object-oriented design, source code management, and software lifecycle best practices. jobTitle: Software Engineer, Sr. Staff - Windows Performance Developer
jobDescription: Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Software Engineering General Summary Qualcomm is looking for an experienced Sr. Staff - Windows Performance Developer with passion for analyzing and optimizing software running on ARM CPU's. Ideal candidate has background to understand and identify/implement software optimizations across multiple layers of Software, Windows Operating System, Kernel, Compiler, Drivers, Assembly Language, CPU microarchitecture and Memory/Bus architecture. As a Senior Staff - Windows Performance Developer, you'll be owning and driving analysis of complex system level performance aspects and coming up with solutions to optimize performance without impacting power consumption to deliver best in class software performance for next generation of Windows on ARM desktop devices using Qualcomm SoC’s. You'll be working closely with software architects, OS and kernel developers, cpu architects and soc architects to define performance optimization strategies to deliver the best performing Windows on ARM desktop devices. We are looking for a self-starter, with excellent people and leadership skills to drive analysis and optimizations with senior technical members from broad set of teams across Qualcomm and external partners. Should be able to self-manage and work through ambiguous issues and requirements. The candidate should have strong written and verbal communication skills. Remote work option within US time zones. Responsibilities In-depth analysis of key software benchmarks and applications to identify optimization opportunities Implement software optimizations to ensure performance criteria is met Develop and enhance analysis tools and instrumentation to assist in analysis, identifying performance gaps and optimization options Present data to the team and leadership on performance gaps and options to optimize Collaborate with internal teams and external partners for analysis and optimizations Skills/experience Experienced in C/C++, ARM assembly Familiarity with C#, Java, Javascript, Python is a plus Strong familiarity with ARM architecture Good understanding of CPU Architecture, Memory and Bus architecture and how that impacts software performance Experienced in performance characterization and software optimization techniques Able to debug complex problems across multiple layers of hardware, OS, compiler, and drivers Experience with Windows OS, Visual Studio/LLVM compiler and Windows Performance Analyzer (WPA) tools is preferred Experience in Compiler and JIT technologies is a plus Experience with optimizing for popular CPU software benchmarks is a plus Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 6+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience. OR Master's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 5+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience. OR PhD in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 4+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience. 3+ years of experience with Programming Language such as C, C++, Java, Python, etc. Preferred Qualifications Master's Degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science or related field. 12+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience. 3+ years of experience with Database Management Software. 3+ years of experience with API. 3+ years of experience working in a large matrixed organization. Principal Duties And Responsibilities Gathers, integrates, and interprets information across sub-systems from a variety of sources in order to troubleshoot issues and find solutions. Serves as a technical expert within area of focus. Identifies gaps in design, effort, etc., and closes the gaps. Identifies risks associated with designs, approaches, and other work efforts. Collaborates with others inside and outside of project team to accomplish project objectives. Solves complex technical problems that affect significant areas of product. Makes decisions based on incomplete, contradictory, and ambiguous requirements and information that affect policies and multiple teams in the software development process. Manages project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables for larger projects. Acts as a tech lead on projects and owns the outcome of the project. Leads others with technical credibility. Level Of Responsibility Working independently with little supervision. Making decisions that are significant in impact; errors are not readily apparent due to the complexity of work process/product or time between decisions and results; errors typically result in significant expenditure of time, resources, and funds to correct. Using verbal and written communication skills to convey complex and/or detailed information to multiple individuals/audiences with differing knowledge levels. May require strong negotiation and influence, communication to large groups or high-level constituents. Having a moderate amount of influence over key organizational decisions (e.g., is consulted by senior leadership to provide input on key decisions). Completing tasks that require multiple steps that can be performed in various orders; tasks require simultaneously executing multiple cognitive abilities and maintaining information in short- or long-term memory. Exercising exceptional creativity to innovate new ideas and develop innovative products/processes without established objectives or known parameters. Using deductive and inductive problem solving; multiple approaches may be taken/necessary to solve the problem; often information is missing or conflicting; advanced data analysis and interpretation skills are required. Occasionally participates in strategic planning within own area affecting immediate operations. The Responsibilities Of This Role Do Not Include Financial accountability (e.g., does not involve budgeting responsibility). Qualcomm is committed to hiring and supporting individuals with disabilities. Examples of expected physical activity include: frequently transporting between offices, buildings, and campuses up to ½ mile; frequently transporting and installing equipment up to 5 lbs; performing tasks at various heights (e.g., standing or sitting); monitoring and utilizing computers and test equipment for more than 6 hours a day; and continuous communication which includes the comprehension of information with colleagues, customers, and vendors both in person and remotely. Although this role has some expected minor physical activity, this should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Software Engineering General Summary Before there were smartphones or smart cities, before autonomous cars or 360 virtual reality videos, there was our technology. Headquartered in San Diego, for over 30 years Qualcomm’s inventions have inspired others to make the impossible, possible. From 5G to artificial intelligence, IoT to automotive and extended reality applications, Qualcomm is inventing the technologies of an intelligently connected future, spearheading research efforts for the next global wireless standard, and collaborating with industry leaders in the wireless value chain to make this future a commercial reality.  As a Software Engineer at Qualcomm, you’ll have the opportunity to push the boundaries of what exists and help establish the new standards for tomorrow. Begin your career as an equal contributor on teams of world-class engineers to develop, implement and maintain wireless and multimedia application software for the world's leading-edge mobile, automotive, and IoT devices. Qualcomm is looking for the next generation of dreamers, inventors, rebels, risk takers, and pioneers to start innovating with them as early as January 2023. When applying, you can specify which technical track(s) you would like to be considered for. By applying here, you are expressing interest in one of our many Qualcomm software engineering positions. It is important to note that this is not a job posting for a specific role. We will review resumes on an ongoing basis, and a recruiter may reach out to you. Minimum Qualifications Graduating with a bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer engineering, computer science, electrical engineering, or a related field no later than July 2023 1+ years’ experience with programming language such as C, C++, Java, Python, etc. Successful candidates will have experience in one or more of the following Software Engineering technical tracks: EMBEDDED SOFTWARE Embedded programming in C/C++/Assembly & operating system knowledge Programming in resource constrained environments (MIPS/Memory) Implementation of complex algorithms on an embedded processor Embedded microcontroller programming, experience developing device drivers SYSTEM INTEGRATION & TEST Test Automation framework design and development using Python Experience w/cellular systems, voice/data, test equipment/tools Communication system knowledge (physical, upper layers) Application layer protocols (TCP/IP, UDP, ICMP) MACHINE LEARNING/ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE Object Oriented software design Mathematical operations: linear algebra, fast math libraries Deep Learning, Machine Learning frameworks: TensorFlow, TFLite, PyTorch, etc. WIRELESS/FIRMWARE Real-time embedded programming in C / C++ / Assembly for general purpose and heterogeneous processors including GPUs and DSPs Communication systems, communication theory, digital signal processing (DSP, embedded firmware) Knowledge of wireless protocols such as 5G NR, LTE and 802.11 AUTOMOTIVE Embedded software driver development in C / C++ / Assembly with OS & Multi-processor concepts Experience in Positioning, Perception or Planning in ADAS/Autonomy Safety critical software development process (Functional Safety), including ASPICE, ASIL, ISO26262, MISRA C++, AUTOSAR C++ ROS/ROS2, DDS, Adaptive AUTOSAR middleware and frameworks APPLICATION/TOOL DEVELOPMENT Development experience in Python, C#, PHP, Web (Flask, ASP.NET, Django, etc.) HTML/CSS, JavaScript/TypeScript, ReactJS, Vue.js, AngularJS individuals within domain to complete the team's work Stays focused and deals with setbacks in a timely manner Seeks out learning opportunities to increase own knowledge and skill Completes assigned coding tasks to specifications on time without significant errors or bugs Resolves straightforward software issues and bugs within a reasonable amount of time Actively seeks answers for new challenges appropriate party (e.g., project lead, colleagues) Networks with colleagues within domain to gain insight, ideas, and connections Level Of Responsibility Working under close supervision Taking over key organizational decisions Role in strategic planning. Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Interns Group, Interns Group > Interim Engineering Intern - SW General Summary Before there were smartphones or smart cities, before autonomous cars or 360 virtual reality videos, there was our technology. Headquartered in San Diego, for over 30 years Qualcomm’s inventions have inspired others to make the impossible, possible. From 5G to artificial intelligence, IoT to automotive and extended reality applications, Qualcomm is inventing the technologies of an intelligently connected future, spearheading research efforts for the next global wireless standard, and collaborating with industry leaders in the wireless value chain to make this future a commercial reality.  We are looking for bright, energetic, motivated students to join Qualcomm’s U.S. 2023 summer intern class! As a Qualcomm Software Engineering Intern, you’ll have the opportunity to push the boundaries of what exists and help establish the new standards for tomorrow. You will innovate as an equal contributor on on teams of world-class engineers to develop, implement, and maintain software for the most complex wireless devices in the industry today. You will leverage your degree in computer science or engineering degree to make an immediate impact on the software development Life cycle of one of Qualcomm Qualcomm’s numerous software technologies. Qualcomm’s Internship Program Working at Qualcomm may be the closest you’ll get to experiencing time travel. You won’t just work in a lab or write lines of code. Our interns join world-class teams to help define and build what is next for mobility and the world. You’ll be paired with a mentor with visibility to your project and team, receive support from your manager, and have access to the entire Qualcomm employee community to ensure your success. To round out your summer internship, we host professional development workshops, social events, cross-functional speaker sessions, and an executive speaker series. In addition to competitive hourly pay and accrued vacation time, you will receive relocation coverage and furnished housing accommodations for the duration of your internship. When applying, you can specify which technical track(s) you would like to be considered for. By applying here, you are expressing interest in one of our many 2023 Qualcomm Software Engineering internships. It is important to note that this is not a job posting for a specific role. We will review resumes on an ongoing basis, and a recruiter may reach out to you. Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > ADAS R&D Systems General Summary From modems that allow vehicles to communicate with cellular networks, other vehicles and their surroundings, to Car-to-Cloud solutions that help vehicle hardware and software stay up-to-date, our role in the auto industry has expanded over the past two decades. We are repeating the same success in Autonomous driving with the Snapdragon Ride Platform. Snapdragon Ride aims to address the complexity of autonomous driving and ADAS by leveraging its high-performance, power-efficient hardware, industry-leading artificial intelligence (AI) technologies and pioneering autonomous driving stack to deliver a comprehensive, cost and energy efficient systems solution. Enabling safe, comfortable, and affordable autonomous driving includes solving some of the most demanding and challenging technological problems. From centimeter-level localization to multimodal sensor perception, sensor fusion, behavior prediction, maneuver planning, and trajectory planning and control, each one of these functions introduces its own unique challenges to solve, verify, test, and deploy on the road. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or related field and 2+ years of Systems Engineering or related work experience. OR Master's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or related field and 1+ years of Systems Engineering or related work experience. OR PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or related field. Preferred Qualifications Experience in defining the SOTIF process for ADAS features Understanding of emerging standards such as UL 4600 Strong system engineering background Good interpersonal and communication skills with a high level of integrity Experience working within a cross-functional team Basic knowledge of ISO 26262 Expert knowledge of ISO 21448 Proven track on development and implementation of SOTIF safety concepts Lead with confidence – thought leaders who empower those around them Proven track on safety analysis methods (FTA, FMEA, STPA) Preferably proven track on technical leadership Feature expert on autonomous L0-L3 driving such as LKA, AEB, ACC, LCC Application specific component expert such as RADARS, Camera, Driver Monitor, or Compute Platform Knowledge and experience in Object Sensing / Detection and Path Prediction Knowledge and experience in Map and Localization Knowledge and experience in Vehicle Dynamics for Autonomous Vehicles Expert on system and vehicle simulations Principal Duties And Responsibilities Contribute to ADAS and Self-Driving feature requirements and provide functional safety guidance on feature definition, design, verification and validation measures. You will utilize various analysis techniques (e.g. HARA, FMEA, STPA) to identify functional insufficiencies at different system levels, including sensing and decision algorithms Derive safety hazards that would contribute to ADAS SOTIF events Develop safety goals/requirements associated with identified ADAS-SOTIF related events Help drive system architecture and controls actions to mitigate SOTIF risk Derive validation and verification test scenarios to demonstrate robustness of ADAS system to SOTIF Data and machine learning algorithm analysis as per SOTIF process Qualifications The SOTIF engineer shall be very familiar with ISO 21448 and be part of working group to develop and modify the SOTIF process to adapt to and apply to the integrated autonomous driving system solutions. The SOTIF engineer shall be responsible to cooperate with SW, HW and SYS engineers to develop the entire project SOTIF safety case for various autonomous driving and ADAS features, including system and component level hazard analysis, use cases, ODD conditions, and SOTIF safety requirements Item description decomposition to identify vehicle level actions required to perform the intended function. ODD decomposition to identify road, weather, and other external disturbances. Manage safety requirements traceability and work with design, implementation, performance, validation and service team members to validate SOTIF requirements Be part of team to develop and modify the SOTIF safety process Lead or support advanced system or component of new feature or new technology from the SOTIF safety perspective Qualcomm is committed to hiring and supporting individuals with disabilities. Although this role has some expected physical activity, an inability to perform one or more of the listed physical requirements should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. We will work with you throughout the application and onboarding process to provide reasonable accommodations. Examples of expected physical activity include: frequently transporting between offices, buildings, and campuses up to ½ mile; frequently transporting and installing equipment up to 5 lbs.; performing tasks at various heights (e.g., standing or sitting); and monitoring and utilizing computers and test equipment for more than 6 hours a day. Although this role has some expected minor physical activity, this should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. If you are an individual with a physical or mental disability and need an accommodation during the application/hiring process, please call Qualcomm’s toll-free number found here for assistance. Qualcomm will provide reasonable accommodations, upon request, to support individuals with disabilities as part of our ongoing efforts to create an accessible workplace. Qualcomm is an equal opportunity employer and supports workforce diversity. To all Staffing and Recruiting Agencies: Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Qualcomm. Staffing and recruiting agencies and individuals being represented by an agency are not authorized to use this site or to submit profiles, applications or resumes, and any such submissions will be considered unsolicited. Qualcomm does not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from agencies. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Qualcomm employees or any other company location. Qualcomm is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/applications. EEO Employer: Qualcomm is an equal opportunity employer; all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or any other protected classification. If you would like more information about this role, please contact Qualcomm Careers.

Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Machine Learning Researcher General Summary Conducts fundamental machine learning research to create new models or new training methods in various technology areas, e.g. deep generative models, Bayesian deep learning, equivariant CNNs, Bayesian optimizations, reinforcement learning, unsupervised learning, and graph NNs. Drives systems innovations for model efficiency advancement on device as well as in the cloud. This includes auto-ML methods (model-based, sampling based, back-propagation based) for the creation and optimization of efficient models (e.g., model compression, quantization, architecture search, and kernel/graph compiler/scheduling) with or without systems-hardware co-design. Performs advanced platform research to enable new machine learning compute paradigm, e.g., compute in memory, on-device learning/training, edge-cloud distributed/federated learning, and quantum machine learning. Creates new innovative machine learning methodology for advanced uses cases to achieve performance beyond the state-of-the-art. Development of and publication of research findings in the form of presentations and conference papers may also be required. Minimum Qualifications Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field and 2+ years of Hardware Engineering, Software Engineering, Systems Engineering, or related work experience. OR PhD in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field. 6+ months of experience developing and/or optimizing machine learning models, systems, platforms, or methods. Preferred Qualifications PhD in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field. 2+ publications at a machine learning conference. 2+ years of experience working in a large matrixed organization. 1+ year of work experience in a role requiring interaction with senior leadership (e.g., Director and above). 1+ year experience with machine learning research related to new models, systems innovations, platforms, or methodology. Principal Duties And Responsibilities Seeks essential knowledge of machine learning industry trends, competitors' products, and advances within area of expertise from publicly available information and research with minimal guidance; shares this information with others on the team. Conducts independent research on complex machine learning within area of expertise to deepen understanding of and contribute to practical and fundamental aspects of machine learning. Develops innovative or patentable ideas for new solutions and works with team to define and implement them; Assists with team members' experiments. Completes complex tasks and solves issues related to the engineering and management of machine learning data with minimal guidance from more experienced engineers. Develops complex new or updated machine learning algorithms, models, and methods that are aligned with research strategies under minimal guidance of more experienced engineers. Conducts rigorous and principled tests and analyzes algorithms, models, and methods in different scenarios to ensure concepts work across environments; interprets results and recommends ways to optimize solutions. Translates research results into publications, workshops, or live demonstrations to engage the research community and communicate the engineering impact of concepts. Contributes to thought leadership and innovation within machine learning area of expertise by publishing research papers, attending and/or presenting at industry or academic conferences, and participating in internal or external training and education. Writes clear and detailed technical documentation and descriptions of research findings for engineers to use or implement research. Level Of Responsibility Working under some supervision. Providing some supervision/guidance to others. Taking responsibility for own work and making decisions with limited impact; impact of decisions is readily apparent; errors made typically only impact timeline (i.e., require additional time to correct). Using verbal and written communication skills to convey information that may be somewhat complex to others who may have limited knowledge of the subject in question. May require basic negotiation and influence, cooperation, tact, and diplomacy, etc. Working within prescribed budget and resources. Completing tasks that do not have defined steps; simultaneous use of multiple mental abilities is generally required to determine the best approach; mistakes may result in significant rework. Exercising substantial creativity to innovate new processes, procedures, or work products within guidelines or to achieve established objectives. Using deductive and inductive problem solving; multiple approaches may be taken/necessary to solve the problem; often information is missing or incomplete; advanced data analysis/interpretation skills may be required. jobTitle: Sr. SoC Architecture – Automotive Platform Architect
jobDescription: Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > SoC Architecture General Summary Qualcomm’s central Platform Architecture team defines common platform architectures & architecture features enabling the next-generation of system-on-chip (SoC) products across Qualcomm’s business lines. One of the most dynamic of these is Qualcomm’s Automotive business line, comprising In-vehicle Infotainment (IVI), the Digital Cockpit, Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS), and Autonomous Driving (AD). Our Automotive Platform Architect role offers qualified candidates the opportunity to broadly influence the development of the SoC architecture for this fast-growing business. Skills/Experience Bachelor of Science degree in EE/ECE/CE/CS or related field required; MS or PhD highly desired Experience in developing high-performance SoC architectures such as server, client-compute, high-end mobile or automotive (preferred) Demonstrated deep technical knowledge and achievements in a variety of silicon architecture domains Collaborative and influential across organizations Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Description A successful candidate will engage collaboratively across Qualcomm’s core SoC Hardware, Software, Product Management teams, and with the Automotive Business Unit to develop scalable and reusable SoC architecture & features enabling efficient development of market-leading SoC products for the Automotive business line. The candidate will have the opportunity to understand the long term SoC architecture needs and roadmap for Automotive SoCs providing for In-vehicle Infotainment (IVI), the Digital Cockpit, Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS), and Autonomous Driving (AD). This role will be in a highly visible position with an excellent opportunity to influence Qualcomm's technical direction, transform the Automotive SoC industry, and change the world! Possible Assignments Depending On Need, Experience, And Skills Engage with the Automotive Business Unit engineering leadership, product management, and product planning teams to understand the product strategy, roadmap, and technology needs. Translate product requirements into SoC platform architecture requirements, encompassing hardware, software, silicon, and other components. Define how the Automotive SoCs fit into the set of overall Qualcomm SoC architecture platforms, and enhance these platforms as necessary to address Automotive needs. Work proactively across Qualcomm’s architecture and core technology teams to ensure a roadmap of architecture platforms and technology feature development supporting the needs of Automotive SoCs. Evaluate architecture proposals, internal and external core IP and component suppliers. Represent Qualcomm with high technical credibility in customer meetings when required, appropriately incorporating feedback. Work closely with the Automotive Business Unit architecture, hardware, and software technical teams to invent and provide high-level engineering solutions to their architecture & technical challenges. Create high level architecture specifications as required to enable core and SoC engineering teams to design, verify, test, and productize SoCs for the Automotive IVI, Digital Cockpit, and AD/ADAS markets. Design experiments and analyses to answer architectural questions, and invent, develop, or drive the development of simulators, models, profilers, and other methods and tools as necessary to execute the analyses. Communicate results and technical concepts clearly and credibly across audiences ranging from individual unit hardware or software engineers to architecture community peers, to high level business executives. Invent and file patents on technical solutions to relevant problems. Preferred Qualifications Areas of Expertise (the more the better): Candidates should have expertise in multiple of the following areas: SoC / Computer Architecture Power and/or performance optimization, simulation, and modeling Software engineering & programming skills (e.g., C/C++, Python, Perl) Knowledge or background in digital hardware design and/or verification Security architecture & standards (e.g., TrustZone, OSEK, SAE J3601, ISO21434) Operating Systems (e.g., Linux) Real-time Systems (e.g., Linux-RT, QNX, RTOS) Arm CPU architecture (e.g., Cortex-A, Cortex-R) Microcontroller (MCUs) and electronic control unit (ECUs) architecture Gateways & Networking (e.g., Ethernet, CAN) Memory architecture (e.g., LPDDRx) Storage architecture (e.g., NANDFlash, NORFlash, SPI) Machine Learning (e.g., CNNs, Computer Vision) In-vehicle Infotainment (IVI) Digital Cockpit Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) Autonomous Driving (AD) architecture Automotive domain & zonal architectures Automotive standards and protocols (e.g., AUTOSAR, NCAP, ISO26262) Safety island & safety management architectures Functional Safety architecture & standards (e.g., ASIL, ISO26262) Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field and 6+ years of Systems Engineering or related work experience. OR Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field and 5+ years of Systems Engineering or related work experience. OR PhD in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field and 4+ years of Systems Engineering or related work experience. 2+ years of experience in one or more system architecture technology areas and products (e.g., Power System, Shared Resource Management, Limits/Thermal Management, Hardware Islands). Although this role has some expected minor physical activity, this should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. jobTitle: Sr. System Analyst and Power Architect
jobDescription: Company Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. Job Area Engineering Group, Engineering Group > CPU Engineering General Summary Physical Requirements Frequently transports and install equipment up to 5 lbs. Performs required tasks at various heights (e.g. standing or sitting). Monitors and utilizes computers and test equipment for more than 6 hours a day. Continuous communication which includes the comprehension of information with colleagues, customers, and vendors both in person and remotely. Minimum Qualifications Our mission is to reimagine silicon and create computing platforms that will transform the industry. You will have the opportunity to work with some of the most talented and passionate engineers in the world to create designs that push the envelope on performance, energy efficiency and scalability. The candidate will be focused on modeling, analysis, and architecture of the power management functions which are integral between the PMIC and the SoC. The candidate must have an understanding of P-state, C-state, and S-state operations. Also, the candidate must be well versed in guard band and load line dynamics and how they are managed inside of the PM unit inside of the SoC. The engineer must be able to define and model the interfaces between the PMIC and the SoC and be able to develop and model algorithms which control the PM activities from the PMIC actions – including error control, limit management, sensor data management, and normal operation in voltage changes. Understanding boot and power down sequences is required. The engineer should have architecture experience in the areas of PMIC’s and SoC to PMIC power management. Skill sets include; Matlab coding and modeling Design experience with RTL Familiar with Cadence environments Advanced node design experience a plus (not necessary) Good communication skills” Although this role has some expected minor physical activity, this should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying.
